contents: Remember this, and never forget how you provoked the LORD your God in the wilderness. From the day you left the land of Egypt until you reached this place, you have been rebelling against the LORD.

contents.verseText: At Horeb you provoked the LORD, and He was angry enough to destroy you.
contents: At Horeb

footnote.ft: That is, Mount Sinai, or possibly a mountain in the range containing Mount Sinai

contents: you provoked the LORD, and He was angry enough to destroy you.

contents.verseText: When I went up on the mountain to receive the tablets of stone, the tablets of the covenant that the LORD made with you, I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights. I ate no bread and drank no water.
contents: When I went up on the mountain to receive the tablets of stone, the tablets of the covenant that the LORD made with you, I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights. I ate no bread and drank no water.

contents.verseText: Then the LORD gave me the two stone tablets, inscribed by the finger of God with the exact words that the LORD spoke to you out of the fire on the mountain on the day of the assembly.
contents: Then the LORD gave me the two stone tablets, inscribed by the finger of God with the exact words that the LORD spoke to you out of the fire on the mountain on the day of the assembly.

contents.verseText: And at the end of forty days and forty nights, the LORD gave me the two stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant.
contents: And at the end of forty days and forty nights, the LORD gave me the two stone tablets, the tablets of the covenant.

contents.verseText: And the LORD said to me, “Get up and go down from here at once, for your people, whom you brought out of Egypt, have corrupted themselves. How quickly they have turned aside from the way that I commanded them! They have made for themselves a molten image.”
contents: And the LORD said to me, “Get up and go down from here at once, for your people, whom you brought out of Egypt, have corrupted themselves. How quickly they have turned aside from the way that I commanded them! They have made for themselves a molten image.”

contents.verseText: The LORD also said to me, “I have seen this people, and they are indeed a stiff-necked people.
contents: The LORD also said to me, “I have seen this people, and they are indeed a stiff-necked people.

contents.verseText: Leave Me alone, so that I may destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven. Then I will make you into a nation mightier and greater than they are.”
contents: Leave Me alone, so that I may destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven. Then I will make you into a nation mightier and greater than they are.”

contents.verseText: So I went back down the mountain while it was blazing with fire, with the two tablets of the covenant in my hands.
contents: So I went back down the mountain while it was blazing with fire, with the two tablets of the covenant in my hands.

contents.verseText: And I saw how you had sinned against the LORD your God; you had made for yourselves a molten calf. You had turned aside quickly from the way that the LORD had commanded you.
contents: And I saw how you had sinned against the LORD your God; you had made for yourselves a molten calf. You had turned aside quickly from the way that the LORD had commanded you.

contents.verseText: So I took the two tablets and threw them out of my hands, shattering them before your eyes.
contents: So I took the two tablets and threw them out of my hands, shattering them before your eyes.

contents.verseText: Then I fell down before the LORD for forty days and forty nights, as I had done the first time. I did not eat bread or drink water because of all the sin you had committed in doing what was evil in the sight of the LORD and provoking Him to anger.
contents: Then I fell down before the LORD for forty days and forty nights, as I had done the first time. I did not eat bread or drink water because of all the sin you had committed in doing what was evil in the sight of the LORD and provoking Him to anger.

contents.verseText: For I was afraid of the anger and wrath that the LORD had directed against you, enough to destroy you. But the LORD listened to me this time as well.
contents: For I was afraid

footnote.ft: LXX And I am greatly terrified; cited in Hebrews 12:21

contents: of the anger and wrath that the LORD had directed against you, enough to destroy you. But the LORD listened to me this time as well.

contents.verseText: The LORD was angry enough with Aaron to destroy him, but at that time I also prayed for Aaron.
contents: The LORD was angry enough with Aaron to destroy him, but at that time I also prayed for Aaron.

contents.verseText: And I took that sinful thing, the calf you had made, and burned it in the fire. Then I crushed it and ground it to powder as fine as dust, and I cast it into the stream that came down from the mountain.
contents: And I took that sinful thing, the calf you had made, and burned it in the fire. Then I crushed it and ground it to powder as fine as dust, and I cast it into the stream that came down from the mountain.

contents.verseText: You continued to provoke the LORD at Taberah, at Massah, and at Kibroth-hattaavah.
contents: You continued to provoke the LORD at Taberah,

footnote.ft: Taberah means burning; see Numbers 11:3.

contents: at Massah,

footnote.ft: Massah means testing; see Exodus 17:7.

contents: and at Kibroth-hattaavah.

footnote.ft: Kibroth-hattaavah means graves of craving; see Numbers 11:34.

contents.verseText: And when the LORD sent you out from Kadesh-barnea, He said, “Go up and possess the land that I have given you.” But you rebelled against the command of the LORD your God. You neither believed Him nor obeyed Him.
contents: And when the LORD sent you out from Kadesh-barnea, He said, “Go up and possess the land that I have given you.”
But you rebelled against the command of the LORD your God. You neither believed Him nor obeyed Him.

contents.verseText: You have been rebelling against the LORD since the day I came to know you.
contents: You have been rebelling against the LORD since the day I came to know you.

contents.verseText: So I fell down before the LORD for forty days and forty nights, because the LORD had said He would destroy you.
contents: So I fell down before the LORD for forty days and forty nights, because the LORD had said He would destroy you.

contents.verseText: And I prayed to the LORD and said, “O Lord GOD, do not destroy Your people, Your inheritance, whom You redeemed through Your greatness and brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand.
contents: And I prayed to the LORD and said, “O Lord GOD, do not destroy Your people, Your inheritance, whom You redeemed through Your greatness and brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand.

contents.verseText: Remember Your servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Overlook the stubbornness of this people and the wickedness of their sin.
contents: Remember Your servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. Overlook the stubbornness of this people and the wickedness of their sin.

contents.verseText: Otherwise, those in the land from which You brought us out will say, ‘Because the LORD was not able to bring them into the land He had promised them, and because He hated them, He has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness.’
contents: Otherwise, those in the land from which You brought us out will say, ‘Because the LORD was not able to bring them into the land He had promised them, and because He hated them, He has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness.’

contents.verseText: But they are Your people, Your inheritance, whom You brought out by Your great power and outstretched arm.”
contents: But they are Your people, Your inheritance, whom You brought out by Your great power and outstretched arm.”

contents.verseText: At that time the LORD said to me, “Chisel out two stone tablets like the originals, come up to Me on the mountain, and make an ark of wood.
contents: At that time the LORD said to me, “Chisel out two stone tablets like the originals, come up to Me on the mountain, and make an ark of wood.

contents.verseText: And I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke; and you are to place them in the ark.”
contents: And I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke; and you are to place them in the ark.”

contents.verseText: So I made an ark of acacia wood, chiseled out two stone tablets like the originals, and went up the mountain with the two tablets in my hands.
contents: So I made an ark of acacia wood, chiseled out two stone tablets like the originals, and went up the mountain with the two tablets in my hands.

contents.verseText: And the LORD wrote on the tablets what had been written previously, the Ten Commandments that He had spoken to you on the mountain out of the fire on the day of the assembly. The LORD gave them to me,
contents: And the LORD wrote on the tablets what had been written previously, the Ten Commandments

footnote.ft: Hebrew the Ten Words

contents: that He had spoken to you on the mountain out of the fire on the day of the assembly. The LORD gave them to me,

contents.verseText: and I went back down the mountain and placed the tablets in the ark I had made, as the LORD had commanded me; and there they have remained.
contents: and I went back down the mountain and placed the tablets in the ark I had made, as the LORD had commanded me; and there they have remained.

contents.verseText: The Israelites traveled from Beeroth Bene-jaakan to Moserah, where Aaron died and was buried, and Eleazar his son succeeded him as priest.
contents: The Israelites traveled from Beeroth Bene-jaakan

footnote.ft: Or from the wells of the Bene-jaakan

contents: to Moserah, where Aaron died and was buried, and Eleazar his son succeeded him as priest.

contents.verseText: From there they traveled to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land with streams of water.
contents: From there they traveled to Gudgodah, and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land with streams of water.

contents.verseText: At that time the LORD set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of the covenant of the LORD, to stand before the LORD to serve Him, and to pronounce blessings in His name, as they do to this day.
contents: At that time the LORD set apart the tribe of Levi to carry the ark of the covenant of the LORD, to stand before the LORD to serve Him, and to pronounce blessings in His name, as they do to this day.

contents.verseText: That is why Levi has no portion or inheritance among his brothers; the LORD is his inheritance, as the LORD your God promised him.
contents: That is why Levi has no portion or inheritance among his brothers; the LORD is his inheritance, as the LORD your God promised him.

contents.verseText: I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights, like the first time, and that time the LORD again listened to me and agreed not to destroy you.
contents: I stayed on the mountain forty days and forty nights, like the first time, and that time the LORD again listened to me and agreed not to destroy you.

contents.verseText: Then the LORD said to me, “Get up. Continue your journey ahead of the people, that they may enter and possess the land that I swore to their fathers to give them.”
contents: Then the LORD said to me, “Get up. Continue your journey ahead of the people, that they may enter and possess the land that I swore to their fathers to give them.”

contents.verseText: And now, O Israel, what does the LORD your God ask of you but to fear the LORD your God by walking in all His ways, to love Him, to serve the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul,
contents: And now, O Israel, what does the LORD your God ask of you but to fear the LORD your God by walking in all His ways, to love Him, to serve the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul,

contents.verseText: and to keep the commandments and statutes of the LORD that I am giving you this day for your own good?
contents: and to keep the commandments and statutes of the LORD that I am giving you this day for your own good?

contents.verseText: Behold, to the LORD your God belong the heavens, even the highest heavens, and the earth and everything in it.
contents: Behold, to the LORD your God belong the heavens, even the highest heavens, and the earth and everything in it.

contents.verseText: Yet the LORD has set His affection on your fathers and loved them. And He has chosen you, their descendants after them, above all the peoples, even to this day.
contents: Yet the LORD has set His affection on your fathers and loved them. And He has chosen you, their descendants after them, above all the peoples, even to this day.

contents.verseText: Circumcise your hearts, therefore, and stiffen your necks no more.
contents: Circumcise your hearts, therefore, and stiffen your necks no more.

contents.verseText: For the LORD your God is God of gods and Lord of lords, the great, mighty, and awesome God, showing no partiality and accepting no bribe.
contents: For the LORD your God is God of gods and Lord of lords, the great, mighty, and awesome God, showing no partiality and accepting no bribe.

contents.verseText: He executes justice for the fatherless and widow, and He loves the foreigner, giving him food and clothing.
contents: He executes justice for the fatherless and widow, and He loves the foreigner, giving him food and clothing.

contents.verseText: So you also must love the foreigner, since you yourselves were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
contents: So you also must love the foreigner, since you yourselves were foreigners in the land of Egypt.

contents.verseText: You are to fear the LORD your God and serve Him. Hold fast to Him and take your oaths in His name.
contents: You are to fear the LORD your God and serve Him. Hold fast to Him and take your oaths in His name.

contents.verseText: He is your praise and He is your God, who has done for you these great and awesome wonders that your eyes have seen.
contents: He is your praise and He is your God, who has done for you these great and awesome wonders that your eyes have seen.

contents.verseText: Your fathers went down to Egypt, seventy in all, and now the LORD your God has made you as numerous as the stars in the sky.
contents: Your fathers went down to Egypt, seventy in all, and now the LORD your God has made you as numerous as the stars in the sky.

contents.verseText: You shall therefore love the LORD your God and always keep His charge, His statutes, His ordinances, and His commandments.
contents: You shall therefore love the LORD your God and always keep His charge, His statutes, His ordinances, and His commandments.

contents.verseText: Know this day that it is not your children who have known and seen the discipline of the LORD your God: His greatness, His mighty hand, and His outstretched arm;
contents: Know this day that it is not your children who have known and seen the discipline of the LORD your God: His greatness, His mighty hand, and His outstretched arm;

contents.verseText: the signs and works He did in Egypt to Pharaoh king of Egypt and all his land;
contents: the signs and works He did in Egypt to Pharaoh king of Egypt and all his land;

contents.verseText: what He did to the Egyptian army and horses and chariots when He made the waters of the Red Sea engulf them as they pursued you, and how He destroyed them completely, even to this day;
contents: what He did to the Egyptian army and horses and chariots when He made the waters of the Red Sea

footnote.ft: Or the Sea of Reeds

contents: engulf them as they pursued you, and how He destroyed them completely, even to this day;

contents.verseText: what He did for you in the wilderness until you reached this place;
contents: what He did for you in the wilderness until you reached this place;

contents.verseText: and what He did in the midst of all the Israelites to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab the Reubenite, when the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them, their households, their tents, and every living thing that belonged to them.
contents: and what He did in the midst of all the Israelites to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab the Reubenite, when the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them, their households, their tents, and every living thing that belonged to them.

contents.verseText: For it is your own eyes that have seen every great work that the LORD has done.
contents: For it is your own eyes that have seen every great work that the LORD has done.

contents.verseText: You shall therefore keep every commandment I am giving you today, so that you may have the strength to go in and possess the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess,
contents: You shall therefore keep every commandment I am giving you today, so that you may have the strength to go in and possess the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess,

contents.verseText: and so that you may live long in the land that the LORD swore to your fathers to give them and their descendants, a land flowing with milk and honey.
contents: and so that you may live long in the land that the LORD swore to your fathers to give them and their descendants, a land flowing with milk and honey.

contents.verseText: For the land that you are entering to possess is not like the land of Egypt, from which you have come, where you sowed your seed and irrigated on foot, like a vegetable garden.
contents: For the land that you are entering to possess is not like the land of Egypt, from which you have come, where you sowed your seed and irrigated on foot, like a vegetable garden.

contents.verseText: But the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess is a land of mountains and valleys that drinks in the rain from heaven.
contents: But the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess is a land of mountains and valleys that drinks in the rain from heaven.

contents.verseText: It is a land for which the LORD your God cares; the eyes of the LORD your God are always on it, from the beginning to the end of the year.
contents: It is a land for which the LORD your God cares; the eyes of the LORD your God are always on it, from the beginning to the end of the year.

contents.verseText: So if you carefully obey the commandments I am giving you today, to love the LORD your God and to serve Him with all your heart and with all your soul,
contents: So if you carefully obey the commandments I am giving you today, to love the LORD your God and to serve Him with all your heart and with all your soul,

contents.verseText: then I will provide rain for your land in season, the autumn and spring rains, that you may gather your grain, new wine, and oil.
contents: then I will provide

footnote.ft: Hebrew; SP, LXX, and Vulgate He will provide; also in verse 15

contents: rain for your land in season, the autumn and spring rains, that you may gather your grain, new wine, and oil.

contents.verseText: And I will provide grass in the fields for your livestock, and you will eat and be satisfied.
contents: And I will provide grass in the fields for your livestock, and you will eat and be satisfied.

contents.verseText: But be careful that you are not enticed to turn aside to worship and bow down to other gods,
contents: But be careful that you are not enticed to turn aside to worship and bow down to other gods,

contents.verseText: or the anger of the LORD will be kindled against you. He will shut the heavens so that there will be no rain, nor will the land yield its produce, and you will soon perish from the good land that the LORD is giving you.
contents: or the anger of the LORD will be kindled against you. He will shut the heavens so that there will be no rain, nor will the land yield its produce, and you will soon perish from the good land that the LORD is giving you.

contents.verseText: Fix these words of mine in your hearts and minds; tie them as reminders on your hands and bind them on your foreheads.
contents: Fix these words of mine in your hearts and minds; tie them as reminders on your hands and bind them on your foreheads.

contents.verseText: Teach them to your children, speaking about them when you sit at home and when you walk along the road, when you lie down and when you get up.
contents: Teach them to your children, speaking about them when you sit at home and when you walk along the road, when you lie down and when you get up.

contents.verseText: Write them on the doorposts of your houses and on your gates,
contents: Write them on the doorposts of your houses and on your gates,

contents.verseText: so that as long as the heavens are above the earth, your days and those of your children may be multiplied in the land that the LORD swore to give your fathers.
contents: so that as long as the heavens are above the earth, your days and those of your children may be multiplied in the land that the LORD swore to give your fathers.

contents.verseText: For if you carefully keep all these commandments I am giving you to follow—to love the LORD your God, to walk in all His ways, and to hold fast to Him—
contents: For if you carefully keep all these commandments I am giving you to follow—to love the LORD your God, to walk in all His ways, and to hold fast to Him—

contents.verseText: then the LORD will drive out all these nations before you, and you will dispossess nations greater and stronger than you.
contents: then the LORD will drive out all these nations before you, and you will dispossess nations greater and stronger than you.

contents.verseText: Every place where the sole of your foot treads will be yours. Your territory will extend from the wilderness to Lebanon, and from the Euphrates River to the Western Sea.
contents: Every place where the sole of your foot treads will be yours. Your territory will extend from the wilderness to Lebanon, and from the Euphrates River to the Western Sea.

footnote.ft: That is, the Mediterranean Sea, also called the Great Sea

contents.verseText: No man will be able to stand against you; the LORD your God will put the fear and dread of you upon all the land, wherever you set foot, as He has promised you.
contents: No man will be able to stand against you; the LORD your God will put the fear and dread of you upon all the land, wherever you set foot, as He has promised you.

contents.verseText: See, today I am setting before you a blessing and a curse—
contents: See, today I am setting before you a blessing and a curse—

contents.verseText: a blessing if you obey the commandments of the LORD your God that I am giving you today,
contents: a blessing if you obey the commandments of the LORD your God that I am giving you today,

contents.verseText: but a curse if you disobey the commandments of the LORD your God and turn aside from the path I command you today by following other gods, which you have not known.
contents: but a curse if you disobey the commandments of the LORD your God and turn aside from the path I command you today by following other gods, which you have not known.

contents.verseText: When the LORD your God brings you into the land you are entering to possess, you are to proclaim the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.
contents: When the LORD your God brings you into the land you are entering to possess, you are to proclaim the blessing on Mount Gerizim and the curse on Mount Ebal.

contents.verseText: Are not these mountains across the Jordan, west of the road toward the sunset, in the land of the Canaanites who live in the Arabah opposite Gilgal near the Oak of Moreh?
contents: Are not these mountains across the Jordan, west of the road toward the sunset, in the land of the Canaanites who live in the Arabah opposite Gilgal near the Oak

footnote.ft: SP, LXX, and Syriac (see Genesis 12:6); Hebrew Oaks or Terebinths or Great Trees

contents: of Moreh?

contents.verseText: For you are about to cross the Jordan to enter and possess the land that the LORD your God is giving you. When you take possession of it and settle in it,
contents: For you are about to cross the Jordan to enter and possess the land that the LORD your God is giving you. When you take possession of it and settle in it,

contents.verseText: be careful to follow all the statutes and ordinances that I am setting before you today.
contents: be careful to follow all the statutes and ordinances that I am setting before you today.

contents.verseText: These are the statutes and ordinances you must be careful to follow all the days you live in the land that the LORD, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess.
contents: These are the statutes and ordinances you must be careful to follow all the days you live in the land that the LORD, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess.

contents.verseText: Destroy completely all the places where the nations you are dispossessing have served their gods—atop the high mountains, on the hills, and under every green tree.
contents: Destroy completely all the places where the nations you are dispossessing have served their gods—atop the high mountains, on the hills, and under every green tree.

contents.verseText: Tear down their altars, smash their sacred pillars, burn up their Asherah poles, cut down the idols of their gods, and wipe out their names from every place.
contents: Tear down their altars, smash their sacred pillars, burn up their Asherah poles, cut down the idols of their gods, and wipe out their names from every place.

contents.verseText: You shall not worship the LORD your God in this way.
contents: You shall not worship the LORD your God in this way.

contents.verseText: Instead, you must seek the place the LORD your God will choose from among all your tribes to establish as a dwelling for His Name, and there you must go.
contents: Instead, you must seek the place the LORD your God will choose from among all your tribes to establish as a dwelling for His Name, and there you must go.

contents.verseText: To that place you are to bring your burnt offerings and sacrifices, your tithes and heave offerings, your vow offerings and freewill offerings, as well as the firstborn of your herds and flocks.
contents: To that place you are to bring your burnt offerings and sacrifices, your tithes and heave offerings, your vow offerings and freewill offerings, as well as the firstborn of your herds and flocks.

contents.verseText: There, in the presence of the LORD your God, you and your households shall eat and rejoice in all you do, because the LORD your God has blessed you.
contents: There, in the presence of the LORD your God, you and your households shall eat and rejoice in all you do, because the LORD your God has blessed you.

contents.verseText: You are not to do as we are doing here today, where everyone does what seems right in his own eyes.
contents: You are not to do as we are doing here today, where everyone does what seems right in his own eyes.

contents.verseText: For you have not yet come to the resting place and the inheritance that the LORD your God is giving you.
contents: For you have not yet come to the resting place and the inheritance that the LORD your God is giving you.

contents.verseText: When you cross the Jordan and live in the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, and He gives you rest from all the enemies around you and you dwell securely,
contents: When you cross the Jordan and live in the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, and He gives you rest from all the enemies around you and you dwell securely,

contents.verseText: then the LORD your God will choose a dwelling for His Name. And there you are to bring everything I command you: your burnt offerings and sacrifices, your tithes and special gifts, and all the choice offerings you vow to the LORD.
contents: then the LORD your God will choose a dwelling for His Name. And there you are to bring everything I command you: your burnt offerings and sacrifices, your tithes and special gifts, and all the choice offerings you vow to the LORD.

contents.verseText: And you shall rejoice before the LORD your God—you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levite within your gates, since he has no portion or inheritance among you.
contents: And you shall rejoice before the LORD your God—you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levite within your gates, since he has no portion or inheritance among you.

contents.verseText: Be careful not to offer your burnt offerings in just any place you see;
contents: Be careful not to offer your burnt offerings in just any place you see;

contents.verseText: you must offer them only in the place the LORD will choose in one of your tribal territories, and there you shall do all that I command you.
contents: you must offer them only in the place the LORD will choose in one of your tribal territories, and there you shall do all that I command you.

contents.verseText: But whenever you want, you may slaughter and eat meat within any of your gates, according to the blessing the LORD your God has given you. Both the ceremonially clean and unclean may eat it as they would a gazelle or deer,
contents: But whenever you want, you may slaughter and eat meat within any of your gates, according to the blessing the LORD your God has given you. Both the ceremonially clean and unclean may eat it as they would a gazelle or deer,

contents.verseText: but you must not eat the blood; pour it on the ground like water.
contents: but you must not eat the blood; pour it on the ground like water.

contents.verseText: Within your gates you must not eat the tithe of your grain or new wine or oil, the firstborn of your herds or flocks, any of the offerings that you have vowed to give, or your freewill offerings or special gifts.
contents: Within your gates you must not eat the tithe of your grain or new wine or oil, the firstborn of your herds or flocks, any of the offerings that you have vowed to give, or your freewill offerings or special gifts.

contents.verseText: Instead, you must eat them in the presence of the LORD your God at the place the LORD your God will choose—you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levite within your gates. Rejoice before the LORD your God in all you do,
contents: Instead, you must eat them in the presence of the LORD your God at the place the LORD your God will choose—you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levite within your gates. Rejoice before the LORD your God in all you do,

contents.verseText: and be careful not to neglect the Levites as long as you live in your land.
contents: and be careful not to neglect the Levites as long as you live in your land.

contents.verseText: When the LORD your God expands your territory as He has promised, and you crave meat and say, “I want to eat meat,” you may eat it whenever you want.
contents: When the LORD your God expands your territory as He has promised, and you crave meat and say, “I want to eat meat,” you may eat it whenever you want.

contents.verseText: If the place where the LORD your God chooses to put His Name is too far from you, then you may slaughter any of the herd or flock He has given you, as I have commanded you, and you may eat it within your gates whenever you want.
contents: If the place where the LORD your God chooses to put His Name is too far from you, then you may slaughter any of the herd or flock He has given you, as I have commanded you, and you may eat it within your gates whenever you want.

contents.verseText: Indeed, you may eat it as you would eat a gazelle or deer; both the ceremonially unclean and the clean may eat it.
contents: Indeed, you may eat it as you would eat a gazelle or deer; both the ceremonially unclean and the clean may eat it.

contents.verseText: Only be sure not to eat the blood, because the blood is the life, and you must not eat the life with the meat.
contents: Only be sure not to eat the blood, because the blood is the life, and you must not eat the life with the meat.

contents.verseText: You must not eat the blood; pour it on the ground like water.
contents: You must not eat the blood; pour it on the ground like water.

contents.verseText: Do not eat it, so that it may go well with you and your children after you, because you will be doing what is right in the eyes of the LORD.
contents: Do not eat it, so that it may go well with you and your children after you, because you will be doing what is right in the eyes of the LORD.

contents.verseText: But you are to take your holy things and your vow offerings and go to the place the LORD will choose.
contents: But you are to take your holy things and your vow offerings and go to the place the LORD will choose.

contents.verseText: Present the meat and blood of your burnt offerings on the altar of the LORD your God. The blood of your other sacrifices must be poured out beside the altar of the LORD your God, but you may eat the meat.
contents: Present the meat and blood of your burnt offerings on the altar of the LORD your God. The blood of your other sacrifices must be poured out beside the altar of the LORD your God, but you may eat the meat.

contents.verseText: Be careful to obey all these things I command you, so that it may always go well with you and your children after you, because you will be doing what is good and right in the eyes of the LORD your God.
contents: Be careful to obey all these things I command you, so that it may always go well with you and your children after you, because you will be doing what is good and right in the eyes of the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: When the LORD your God cuts off before you the nations you are entering to dispossess, and you drive them out and live in their land,
contents: When the LORD your God cuts off before you the nations you are entering to dispossess, and you drive them out and live in their land,

contents.verseText: be careful not to be ensnared by their ways after they have been destroyed before you. Do not inquire about their gods, asking, “How do these nations serve their gods? I will do likewise.”
contents: be careful not to be ensnared by their ways after they have been destroyed before you. Do not inquire about their gods, asking, “How do these nations serve their gods? I will do likewise.”

contents.verseText: You must not worship the LORD your God in this way, because they practice for their gods every abomination which the LORD hates. They even burn their sons and daughters in the fire as sacrifices to their gods.
contents: You must not worship the LORD your God in this way, because they practice for their gods every abomination which the LORD hates. They even burn their sons and daughters in the fire as sacrifices to their gods.

contents.verseText: See that you do everything I command you; do not add to it or subtract from it.
contents: See that you do everything I command you; do not add to it or subtract from it.

s1: Idolaters to Be Put to Death

contents.verseText: If a prophet or dreamer of dreams arises among you and proclaims a sign or wonder to you,
contents: If a prophet or dreamer of dreams arises among you and proclaims a sign or wonder to you,

contents.verseText: and if the sign or wonder he has spoken to you comes about, but he says, “Let us follow other gods (which you have not known) and let us worship them,”
contents: and if the sign or wonder he has spoken to you comes about, but he says, “Let us follow other gods (which you have not known) and let us worship them,”

contents.verseText: you must not listen to the words of that prophet or dreamer. For the LORD your God is testing you to find out whether you love Him with all your heart and with all your soul.
contents: you must not listen to the words of that prophet or dreamer. For the LORD your God is testing you to find out whether you love Him with all your heart and with all your soul.

contents.verseText: You are to follow the LORD your God and fear Him. Keep His commandments and listen to His voice; serve Him and hold fast to Him.
contents: You are to follow the LORD your God and fear Him. Keep His commandments and listen to His voice; serve Him and hold fast to Him.

contents.verseText: Such a prophet or dreamer must be put to death, because he has advocated rebellion against the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and redeemed you from the house of slavery; he has tried to turn you from the way in which the LORD your God has commanded you to walk. So you must purge the evil from among you.
contents: Such a prophet or dreamer must be put to death, because he has advocated rebellion against the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and redeemed you from the house of slavery; he has tried to turn you from the way in which the LORD your God has commanded you to walk. So you must purge the evil from among you.

footnote.ft: Cited in 1 Corinthians 5:13

contents.verseText: If your very own brother, or your son or daughter, or the wife you embrace, or your closest friend secretly entices you, saying, “Let us go and worship other gods” (which neither you nor your fathers have known,
contents: If your very own brother, or your son or daughter, or the wife you embrace,

footnote.ft: Hebrew the wife of your bosom

contents: or your closest friend secretly entices you, saying, “Let us go and worship other gods” (which neither you nor your fathers have known,

contents.verseText: the gods of the peoples around you, whether near or far, whether from one end of the earth or the other),
contents: the gods of the peoples around you, whether near or far, whether from one end of the earth or the other),

contents.verseText: you must not yield to him or listen to him. Show him no pity, and do not spare him or shield him.
contents: you must not yield to him or listen to him. Show him no pity, and do not spare him or shield him.

contents.verseText: Instead, you must surely kill him. Your hand must be the first against him to put him to death, and then the hands of all the people.
contents: Instead, you must surely kill him. Your hand must be the first against him to put him to death, and then the hands of all the people.

contents.verseText: Stone him to death for trying to turn you away from the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
contents: Stone him to death for trying to turn you away from the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.

contents.verseText: Then all Israel will hear and be afraid, and will never again do such a wicked thing among you.
contents: Then all Israel will hear and be afraid, and will never again do such a wicked thing among you.

contents.verseText: If, regarding one of the cities the LORD your God is giving you to inhabit, you hear it said
contents: If, regarding one of the cities the LORD your God is giving you to inhabit, you hear it said

contents.verseText: that wicked men have arisen from among you and have led the people of their city astray, saying, “Let us go and serve other gods” (which you have not known),
contents: that wicked men have arisen from among you and have led the people of their city astray, saying, “Let us go and serve other gods” (which you have not known),

contents.verseText: then you must inquire, investigate, and interrogate thoroughly. And if it is established with certainty that this abomination has been committed among you,
contents: then you must inquire, investigate, and interrogate thoroughly. And if it is established with certainty that this abomination has been committed among you,

contents.verseText: you must surely put the inhabitants of that city to the sword. Devote to destruction all its people and livestock.
contents: you must surely put the inhabitants of that city to the sword. Devote to destruction

footnote.ft: Forms of the Hebrew cherem refer to the giving over of things or persons to the LORD, either by destroying them or by giving them as an offering; similarly in verse 17.

contents: all its people and livestock.

contents.verseText: And you are to gather all its plunder in the middle of the public square, and completely burn the city and all its plunder as a whole burnt offering to the LORD your God. The city must remain a mound of ruins forever, never to be rebuilt.
contents: And you are to gather all its plunder in the middle of the public square, and completely burn the city and all its plunder as a whole burnt offering to the LORD your God. The city must remain a mound of ruins forever, never to be rebuilt.

contents.verseText: Nothing devoted to destruction shall cling to your hands, so that the LORD will turn from His fierce anger, grant you mercy, show you compassion, and multiply you as He swore to your fathers,
contents: Nothing devoted to destruction shall cling to your hands, so that the LORD will turn from His fierce anger, grant you mercy, show you compassion, and multiply you as He swore to your fathers,

contents.verseText: because you obey the LORD your God, keeping all His commandments I am giving you today and doing what is right in the eyes of the LORD your God.
contents: because you obey the LORD your God, keeping all His commandments I am giving you today and doing what is right in the eyes of the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: You are sons of the LORD your God; do not cut yourselves or shave your foreheads on behalf of the dead,
contents: You are sons of the LORD your God; do not cut yourselves or shave your foreheads on behalf of the dead,

contents.verseText: for you are a people holy to the LORD your God. The LORD has chosen you to be a people for His prized possession out of all the peoples on the face of the earth.
contents: for you are a people holy to the LORD your God. The LORD has chosen you to be a people for His prized possession out of all the peoples on the face of the earth.

contents.verseText: You must not eat any detestable thing.
contents: You must not eat any detestable thing.

contents: These are the animals that you may eat:

li1: The ox, the sheep, the goat,

contents.verseText: the deer, the gazelle, the roe deer, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, and the mountain sheep.
contents: the deer, the gazelle, the roe deer,

li1: the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope,

contents: You may eat any animal that has a split hoof divided in two and that chews the cud.

contents: as well as the pig; though it has a divided hoof, it does not chew the cud. It is unclean for you. You must not eat its meat or touch its carcass.

contents.verseText: Of all the creatures that live in the water, you may eat anything with fins and scales,
contents: Of all the creatures that live in the water, you may eat anything with fins and scales,

contents.verseText: but you may not eat anything that does not have fins and scales; it is unclean for you.
contents: but you may not eat anything that does not have fins and scales; it is unclean for you.

contents.verseText: You may eat any clean bird,
contents: You may eat any clean bird,

contents: but these you may not eat:

li1: the eagle, the bearded vulture, the black vulture,

contents.verseText: the red kite, the falcon, any kind of kite, 1
contents: the red kite, the falcon, any kind of kite,

contents.verseText: the stork, any kind of heron, the hoopoe, or the bat.

contents.verseText: All flying insects are unclean for you; they may not be eaten.
contents: All flying insects are unclean for you; they may not be eaten.

contents.verseText: But you may eat any clean bird.
contents: But you may eat any clean bird.

contents.verseText: You are not to eat any carcass; you may give it to the foreigner residing within your gates, and he may eat it, or you may sell it to a foreigner. For you are a holy people belonging to the LORD your God. You must not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.
contents: You are not to eat any carcass; you may give it to the foreigner residing within your gates, and he may eat it, or you may sell it to a foreigner. For you are a holy people belonging to the LORD your God.
You must not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.

contents.verseText: You must be sure to set aside a tenth of all the produce brought forth each year from your fields.
contents: You must be sure to set aside a tenth of all the produce brought forth each year from your fields.

contents.verseText: And you are to eat a tenth of your grain, new wine, and oil, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks, in the presence of the LORD your God at the place He will choose as a dwelling for His Name, so that you may learn to fear the LORD your God always.
contents: And you are to eat a tenth of your grain, new wine, and oil, and the firstborn of your herds and flocks, in the presence of the LORD your God at the place He will choose as a dwelling for His Name, so that you may learn to fear the LORD your God always.

contents.verseText: But if the distance is too great for you to carry that with which the LORD your God has blessed you, because the place where the LORD your God will choose to put His Name is too far away,
contents: But if the distance is too great for you to carry that with which the LORD your God has blessed you, because the place where the LORD your God will choose to put His Name is too far away,

contents.verseText: then exchange it for money, take the money in your hand, and go to the place the LORD your God will choose.
contents: then exchange it for money, take the money in your hand, and go to the place the LORD your God will choose.

contents.verseText: Then you may spend the money on anything you desire: cattle, sheep, wine, strong drink, or anything you wish. You are to feast there in the presence of the LORD your God and rejoice with your household.
contents: Then you may spend the money on anything you desire: cattle, sheep, wine, strong drink, or anything you wish. You are to feast there in the presence of the LORD your God and rejoice with your household.

contents.verseText: And do not neglect the Levite within your gates, since he has no portion or inheritance among you.
contents: And do not neglect the Levite within your gates, since he has no portion or inheritance among you.

contents.verseText: At the end of every three years, bring a tenth of all your produce for that year and lay it up within your gates.
contents: At the end of every three years, bring a tenth of all your produce for that year and lay it up within your gates.

contents.verseText: Then the Levite (because he has no portion or inheritance among you), the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow within your gates may come and eat and be satisfied. And the LORD your God will bless you in all the work of your hands.
contents: Then the Levite (because he has no portion or inheritance among you), the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow within your gates may come and eat and be satisfied. And the LORD your God will bless you in all the work of your hands.

contents.verseText: At the end of every seven years you must cancel debts.
contents: At the end of every seven years you must cancel debts.

contents.verseText: This is the manner of remission: Every creditor shall cancel what he has loaned to his neighbor. He is not to collect anything from his neighbor or brother, because the LORD’s time of release has been proclaimed.
contents: This is the manner of remission: Every creditor shall cancel what he has loaned to his neighbor. He is not to collect anything from his neighbor or brother, because the LORD’s time of release has been proclaimed.

contents.verseText: You may collect something from a foreigner, but you must forgive whatever your brother owes you.
contents: You may collect something from a foreigner, but you must forgive whatever your brother owes you.

contents.verseText: There will be no poor among you, however, because the LORD will surely bless you in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess as an inheritance,
contents: There will be no poor among you, however, because the LORD will surely bless you in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess as an inheritance,

contents.verseText: if only you obey the LORD your God and are careful to follow all these commandments I am giving you today.
contents: if only you obey the LORD your God and are careful to follow all these commandments I am giving you today.

contents.verseText: When the LORD your God blesses you as He has promised, you will lend to many nations but borrow from none; you will rule over many nations but be ruled by none.
contents: When the LORD your God blesses you as He has promised, you will lend to many nations but borrow from none; you will rule over many nations but be ruled by none.

contents.verseText: If there is a poor man among your brothers within any of the gates in the land that the LORD your God is giving you, then you are not to harden your heart or shut your hand from your poor brother.
contents: If there is a poor man among your brothers within any of the gates in the land that the LORD your God is giving you, then you are not to harden

footnote.ft: Or make strong or make courageous

contents: your heart or shut your hand from your poor brother.

contents.verseText: Instead, you are to open your hand to him and freely loan him whatever he needs.
contents: Instead, you are to open your hand to him and freely loan him whatever he needs.

contents.verseText: Be careful not to harbor this wicked thought in your heart: “The seventh year, the year of release, is near,” so that you look upon your poor brother begrudgingly and give him nothing. He will cry out to the LORD against you, and you will be guilty of sin.
contents: Be careful not to harbor this wicked thought in your heart: “The seventh year, the year of release, is near,” so that you look upon your poor brother begrudgingly and give him nothing. He will cry out to the LORD against you, and you will be guilty of sin.

contents.verseText: Give generously to him, and do not let your heart be grieved when you do so. And because of this the LORD your God will bless you in all your work and in everything to which you put your hand.
contents: Give generously to him, and do not let your heart be grieved when you do so. And because of this the LORD your God will bless you in all your work and in everything to which you put your hand.

contents.verseText: For there will never cease to be poor in the land; that is why I am commanding you to open wide your hand to your brother and to the poor and needy in your land.
contents: For there will never cease to be poor in the land; that is why I am commanding you to open wide your hand to your brother and to the poor and needy in your land.

contents.verseText: If a fellow Hebrew, a man or a woman, is sold to you and serves you six years, then in the seventh year you must set him free.
contents: If a fellow Hebrew, a man or a woman, is sold

footnote.ft: Or sells himself

contents: to you and serves you six years, then in the seventh year you must set him free.

contents.verseText: And when you release him, do not send him away empty-handed.
contents: And when you release him, do not send him away empty-handed.

contents.verseText: You are to furnish him liberally from your flock, your threshing floor, and your winepress. You shall give to him as the LORD your God has blessed you.
contents: You are to furnish him liberally from your flock, your threshing floor, and your winepress. You shall give to him as the LORD your God has blessed you.

contents.verseText: Remember that you were slaves in the land of Egypt, and the LORD your God redeemed you; that is why I am giving you this command today.
contents: Remember that you were slaves in the land of Egypt, and the LORD your God redeemed you; that is why I am giving you this command today.

contents.verseText: But if your servant says to you, ‘I do not want to leave you,’ because he loves you and your household and is well off with you,
contents: But if your servant says to you, ‘I do not want to leave you,’ because he loves you and your household and is well off with you,

contents.verseText: then take an awl and pierce it through his ear into the door, and he will become your servant for life. And treat your maidservant the same way.
contents: then take an awl and pierce it through his ear into the door, and he will become your servant for life. And treat your maidservant the same way.

contents.verseText: Do not regard it as a hardship to set your servant free, because his six years of service were worth twice the wages of a hired hand. And the LORD your God will bless you in all you do.
contents: Do not regard it as a hardship to set your servant free, because his six years of service were worth twice the wages of a hired hand. And the LORD your God will bless you in all you do.

contents.verseText: You must set apart to the LORD your God every firstborn male produced by your herds and flocks. You are not to put the firstborn of your oxen to work, nor are you to shear the firstborn of your flock.
contents: You must set apart to the LORD your God every firstborn male produced by your herds and flocks. You are not to put the firstborn of your oxen to work, nor are you to shear the firstborn of your flock.

contents.verseText: Each year you and your household are to eat it before the LORD your God in the place the LORD will choose.
contents: Each year you and your household are to eat it before the LORD your God in the place the LORD will choose.

contents.verseText: But if an animal has a defect, is lame or blind, or has any serious flaw, you must not sacrifice it to the LORD your God.
contents: But if an animal has a defect, is lame or blind, or has any serious flaw, you must not sacrifice it to the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: Eat it within your gates; both the ceremonially unclean and clean may eat it as they would a gazelle or a deer.
contents: Eat it within your gates; both the ceremonially unclean and clean may eat it as they would a gazelle or a deer.

contents.verseText: But you must not eat the blood; pour it on the ground like water.
contents: But you must not eat the blood; pour it on the ground like water.

s1: Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread

contents.verseText: Observe the month of Abib and celebrate the Passover to the LORD your God, because in the month of Abib the LORD your God brought you out of Egypt by night.
contents: Observe the month of Abib

footnote.ft: Abib was the first month of the ancient Hebrew lunar calendar, usually occurring within the months of March and April; twice in this verse.

contents: and celebrate the Passover to the LORD your God, because in the month of Abib the LORD your God brought you out of Egypt by night.

contents.verseText: You are to offer to the LORD your God the Passover sacrifice from the herd or flock in the place the LORD will choose as a dwelling for His Name.
contents: You are to offer to the LORD your God the Passover sacrifice from the herd or flock in the place the LORD will choose as a dwelling for His Name.

contents.verseText: You must not eat leavened bread with it; for seven days you are to eat with it unleavened bread, the bread of affliction, because you left the land of Egypt in haste—so that you may remember for the rest of your life the day you left the land of Egypt.
contents: You must not eat leavened bread with it; for seven days you are to eat with it unleavened bread, the bread of affliction, because you left the land of Egypt in haste—so that you may remember for the rest of your life the day you left the land of Egypt.

contents.verseText: No leaven is to be found in all your land for seven days, and none of the meat you sacrifice in the evening of the first day shall remain until morning.
contents: No leaven is to be found in all your land for seven days, and none of the meat you sacrifice in the evening of the first day shall remain until morning.

contents.verseText: You are not to sacrifice the Passover animal in any of the towns that the LORD your God is giving you.
contents: You are not to sacrifice the Passover animal in any of the towns that the LORD your God is giving you.

contents.verseText: You must only offer the Passover sacrifice at the place the LORD your God will choose as a dwelling for His Name. Do this in the evening as the sun sets, at the same time you departed from Egypt.
contents: You must only offer the Passover sacrifice at the place the LORD your God will choose as a dwelling for His Name. Do this in the evening as the sun sets, at the same time you departed from Egypt.

contents.verseText: And you shall roast it and eat it in the place the LORD your God will choose, and in the morning you shall return to your tents.
contents: And you shall roast it and eat it in the place the LORD your God will choose, and in the morning you shall return to your tents.

contents.verseText: For six days you must eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day you shall hold a solemn assembly to the LORD your God, and you must not do any work.
contents: For six days you must eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day you shall hold a solemn assembly to the LORD your God, and you must not do any work.

contents.verseText: You are to count off seven weeks from the time you first put the sickle to the standing grain.
contents: You are to count off seven weeks from the time you first put the sickle to the standing grain.

contents.verseText: And you shall celebrate the Feast of Weeks to the LORD your God with a freewill offering that you give in proportion to how the LORD your God has blessed you,
contents: And you shall celebrate the Feast of Weeks

footnote.ft: That is, Shavuot; see footnotes for verse 16.

contents: to the LORD your God with a freewill offering that you give in proportion to how the LORD your God has blessed you,

contents.verseText: and you shall rejoice before the LORD your God in the place He will choose as a dwelling for His Name—you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levite within your gates, as well as the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widows among you.
contents: and you shall rejoice before the LORD your God in the place He will choose as a dwelling for His Name—you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levite within your gates, as well as the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widows among you.

contents.verseText: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt, and carefully follow these statutes.
contents: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt, and carefully follow these statutes.

contents.verseText: You are to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles for seven days after you have gathered the produce of your threshing floor and your winepress.
contents: You are to celebrate the Feast of Tabernacles

footnote.ft: Or Booths or Shelters; see footnotes for verse 16.

contents: for seven days after you have gathered the produce of your threshing floor and your winepress.

contents.verseText: And you shall rejoice in your feast—you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levite, as well as the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widows among you.
contents: And you shall rejoice in your feast—you, your sons and daughters, your menservants and maidservants, and the Levite, as well as the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widows among you.

contents.verseText: For seven days you shall celebrate a feast to the LORD your God in the place He will choose, because the LORD your God will bless you in all your produce and in all the work of your hands, so that your joy will be complete.
contents: For seven days you shall celebrate a feast to the LORD your God in the place He will choose, because the LORD your God will bless you in all your produce and in all the work of your hands, so that your joy will be complete.

contents.verseText: Three times a year all your men are to appear before the LORD your God in the place He will choose: at the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the Feast of Weeks, and the Feast of Tabernacles. No one should appear before the LORD empty-handed.
contents: Three times a year all your men are to appear before the LORD your God in the place He will choose: at the Feast of Unleavened Bread,

footnote.ft: That is, the seven-day period after the Passover during which no leaven may be eaten; see Exodus 12:14–20.

contents: the Feast of Weeks,

footnote.ft: That is, Shavuot, the late spring feast of pilgrimage to Jerusalem; it is also known as the Feast of Harvest (see Exodus 23:16) or the Feast of Pentecost (see Acts 2:1).

contents: and the Feast of Tabernacles.

footnote.ft: That is, Sukkot, the autumn feast of pilgrimage to Jerusalem; also translated as the Feast of Booths or the Feast of Shelters and originally called the Feast of Ingathering (see Exodus 23:16 and Exodus 34:22).

contents: No one should appear before the LORD empty-handed.

contents.verseText: Everyone must appear with a gift as he is able, according to the blessing the LORD your God has given you.
contents: Everyone must appear with a gift as he is able, according to the blessing the LORD your God has given you.

contents.verseText: You are to appoint judges and officials for your tribes in every town that the LORD your God is giving you. They are to judge the people with righteous judgment.
contents: You are to appoint judges and officials for your tribes in every town that the LORD your God is giving you. They are to judge the people with righteous judgment.

contents.verseText: Do not deny justice or show partiality. Do not accept a bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and twists the words of the righteous.
contents: Do not deny justice or show partiality. Do not accept a bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and twists the words of the righteous.

contents.verseText: Pursue justice, and justice alone, so that you may live, and you may possess the land that the LORD your God is giving you.
contents: Pursue justice, and justice alone, so that you may live, and you may possess the land that the LORD your God is giving you.

contents.verseText: Do not set up any wooden Asherah pole next to the altar you will build for the LORD your God,
contents: Do not set up any wooden Asherah pole next to the altar you will build for the LORD your God,

contents.verseText: and do not set up for yourselves a sacred pillar, which the LORD your God hates.
contents: and do not set up for yourselves a sacred pillar, which the LORD your God hates.

contents.verseText: You shall not sacrifice to the LORD your God an ox or a sheep with any defect or serious flaw, for that is detestable to the LORD your God.
contents: You shall not sacrifice to the LORD your God an ox or a sheep with any defect or serious flaw, for that is detestable to the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: If a man or woman among you in one of the towns that the LORD your God gives you is found doing evil in the sight of the LORD your God by transgressing His covenant
contents: If a man or woman among you in one of the towns that the LORD your God gives you is found doing evil in the sight of the LORD your God by transgressing His covenant

contents.verseText: and going to worship other gods, bowing down to them or to the sun or moon or any of the host of heaven—which I have forbidden—
contents: and going to worship other gods, bowing down to them or to the sun or moon or any of the host of heaven—which I have forbidden—

contents.verseText: and if it is reported and you hear about it, you must investigate it thoroughly. If the report is true and such an abomination has happened in Israel,
contents: and if it is reported and you hear about it, you must investigate it thoroughly.
If the report is true and such an abomination has happened in Israel,

contents.verseText: you must bring out to your gates the man or woman who has done this evil thing, and you must stone that person to death.
contents: you must bring out to your gates the man or woman who has done this evil thing, and you must stone that person to death.

contents.verseText: On the testimony of two or three witnesses a man shall be put to death, but he shall not be executed on the testimony of a lone witness.
contents: On the testimony of two or three witnesses a man shall be put to death, but he shall not be executed on the testimony of a lone witness.

contents.verseText: The hands of the witnesses shall be the first in putting him to death, and after that, the hands of all the people. So you must purge the evil from among you.
contents: The hands of the witnesses shall be the first in putting him to death, and after that, the hands of all the people. So you must purge the evil from among you.

footnote.ft: Cited in 1 Corinthians 5:13

contents.verseText: If a case is too difficult for you to judge, whether the controversy within your gates is regarding bloodshed, lawsuits, or assaults, you must go up to the place the LORD your God will choose.
contents: If a case is too difficult for you to judge, whether the controversy within your gates is regarding bloodshed, lawsuits, or assaults, you must go up to the place the LORD your God will choose.

contents.verseText: You are to go to the Levitical priests and to the judge who presides at that time. Inquire of them, and they will give you a verdict in the case.
contents: You are to go to the Levitical priests and to the judge who presides at that time. Inquire of them, and they will give you a verdict in the case.

contents.verseText: You must abide by the verdict they give you at the place the LORD will choose. Be careful to do everything they instruct you,
contents: You must abide by the verdict they give you at the place the LORD will choose. Be careful to do everything they instruct you,

contents.verseText: according to the terms of law they give and the verdict they proclaim. Do not turn aside to the right or to the left from the decision they declare to you.
contents: according to the terms of law they give and the verdict they proclaim. Do not turn aside to the right or to the left from the decision they declare to you.

contents.verseText: But the man who acts presumptuously, refusing to listen either to the priest who stands there to serve the LORD your God, or to the judge, must be put to death. You must purge the evil from Israel.
contents: But the man who acts presumptuously, refusing to listen either to the priest who stands there to serve the LORD your God, or to the judge, must be put to death. You must purge the evil from Israel.

contents.verseText: Then all the people will hear and be afraid, and will no longer behave arrogantly.
contents: Then all the people will hear and be afraid, and will no longer behave arrogantly.

contents.verseText: When you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you and have taken possession of it and settled in it, and you say, “Let us set a king over us like all the nations around us,”
contents: When you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you and have taken possession of it and settled in it, and you say, “Let us set a king over us like all the nations around us,”

contents.verseText: you are to appoint over yourselves the king whom the LORD your God shall choose. Appoint a king from among your brothers; you are not to set over yourselves a foreigner who is not one of your brothers.
contents: you are to appoint over yourselves the king whom the LORD your God shall choose. Appoint a king from among your brothers; you are not to set over yourselves a foreigner who is not one of your brothers.

contents.verseText: But the king must not acquire many horses for himself or send the people back to Egypt to acquire more horses, for the LORD has said, ‘You are never to go back that way again.’
contents: But the king must not acquire many horses for himself or send the people back to Egypt to acquire more horses, for the LORD has said, ‘You are never to go back that way again.’

contents.verseText: He must not take many wives for himself, lest his heart go astray. He must not accumulate for himself large amounts of silver and gold.
contents: He must not take many wives for himself, lest his heart go astray. He must not accumulate for himself large amounts of silver and gold.

contents.verseText: When he is seated on his royal throne, he must write for himself a copy of this instruction on a scroll in the presence of the Levitical priests.
contents: When he is seated on his royal throne, he must write for himself a copy of this instruction on a scroll in the presence of the Levitical priests.

contents.verseText: It is to remain with him, and he is to read from it all the days of his life, so that he may learn to fear the LORD his God by carefully observing all the words of this instruction and these statutes.
contents: It is to remain with him, and he is to read from it all the days of his life, so that he may learn to fear the LORD his God by carefully observing all the words of this instruction and these statutes.

contents.verseText: Then his heart will not be exalted above his countrymen, and he will not turn aside from the commandment, to the right or to the left, in order that he and his sons may reign many years over his kingdom in Israel.
contents: Then his heart will not be exalted above his countrymen, and he will not turn aside from the commandment, to the right or to the left, in order that he and his sons may reign many years over his kingdom in Israel.

contents.verseText: The Levitical priests—indeed the whole tribe of Levi—shall have no portion or inheritance with Israel. They are to eat the offerings made by fire to the LORD; that is their inheritance.
contents: The Levitical priests—indeed the whole tribe of Levi—shall have no portion or inheritance with Israel. They are to eat the offerings made by fire to the LORD; that is their inheritance.

contents.verseText: Although they have no inheritance among their brothers, the LORD is their inheritance, as He promised them.
contents: Although they have no inheritance among their brothers, the LORD is their inheritance, as He promised them.

contents.verseText: This shall be the priests’ share from the people who offer a sacrifice, whether a bull or a sheep: the priests are to be given the shoulder, the jowls, and the stomach.
contents: This shall be the priests’ share from the people who offer a sacrifice, whether a bull or a sheep: the priests are to be given the shoulder, the jowls, and the stomach.

contents.verseText: You are to give them the firstfruits of your grain, new wine, and oil, and the first wool sheared from your flock.
contents: You are to give them the firstfruits of your grain, new wine, and oil, and the first wool sheared from your flock.

contents.verseText: For the LORD your God has chosen Levi and his sons out of all your tribes to stand and minister in His name for all time.
contents: For the LORD your God has chosen Levi and his sons out of all your tribes to stand and minister in His name for all time.

contents.verseText: Now if a Levite moves from any town of residence throughout Israel and comes in all earnestness to the place the LORD will choose,
contents: Now if a Levite moves from any town of residence throughout Israel and comes in all earnestness to the place the LORD will choose,

contents.verseText: then he shall serve in the name of the LORD his God like all his fellow Levites who stand there before the LORD.
contents: then he shall serve in the name of the LORD his God like all his fellow Levites who stand there before the LORD.

contents.verseText: They shall eat equal portions, even though he has received money from the sale of his father’s estate.
contents: They shall eat equal portions, even though he has received money from the sale of his father’s estate.

contents.verseText: When you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you, do not imitate the detestable ways of the nations there.
contents: When you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you, do not imitate the detestable ways of the nations there.

contents.verseText: Let no one be found among you who sacrifices his son or daughter in the fire, practices divination or conjury, interprets omens, practices sorcery,
contents: Let no one be found among you who sacrifices his son or daughter in the fire,

footnote.ft: Literally makes his son or his daughter pass through the fire

contents: practices divination or conjury, interprets omens, practices sorcery,

contents.verseText: casts spells, consults a medium or spiritist, or inquires of the dead.
contents: casts spells, consults a medium or spiritist, or inquires of the dead.

contents.verseText: For whoever does these things is detestable to the LORD. And because of these detestable things, the LORD your God is driving out the nations before you.
contents: For whoever does these things is detestable to the LORD. And because of these detestable things, the LORD your God is driving out the nations before you.

contents.verseText: You must be blameless before the LORD your God.
contents: You must be blameless before the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: Though these nations, which you will dispossess, listen to conjurers and diviners, the LORD your God has not permitted you to do so.
contents: Though these nations, which you will dispossess, listen to conjurers and diviners, the LORD your God has not permitted you to do so.

contents.verseText: The LORD your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your brothers. You must listen to him.
contents: The LORD your God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your brothers. You must listen to him.

footnote.ft: Cited in Acts 3:22

contents.verseText: This is what you asked of the LORD your God at Horeb on the day of the assembly, when you said, “Let us not hear the voice of the LORD our God or see this great fire anymore, so that we will not die!”
contents: This is what you asked of the LORD your God at Horeb

footnote.ft: That is, Mount Sinai, or possibly a mountain in the range containing Mount Sinai

contents: on the day of the assembly, when you said, “Let us not hear the voice of the LORD our God or see this great fire anymore, so that we will not die!”

contents.verseText: Then the LORD said to me, “They have spoken well.
contents: Then the LORD said to me, “They have spoken well.

contents.verseText: I will raise up for them a prophet like you from among their brothers. I will put My words in his mouth, and he will tell them everything I command him.
contents: I will raise up for them a prophet like you from among their brothers. I will put My words in his mouth, and he will tell them everything I command him.

contents.verseText: And I will hold accountable anyone who does not listen to My words that the prophet speaks in My name.
contents: And I will hold accountable anyone who does not listen to My words that the prophet speaks in My name.

footnote.ft: See Acts 3:23.

contents.verseText: But if any prophet dares to speak a message in My name that I have not commanded him to speak, or to speak in the name of other gods, that prophet must be put to death.”
contents: But if any prophet dares to speak a message in My name that I have not commanded him to speak, or to speak in the name of other gods, that prophet must be put to death.”

contents.verseText: You may ask in your heart, “How can we recognize a message that the LORD has not spoken?”
contents: You may ask in your heart, “How can we recognize a message that the LORD has not spoken?”

contents.verseText: When a prophet speaks in the name of the LORD and the message does not come to pass or come true, that is a message the LORD has not spoken. The prophet has spoken presumptuously. Do not be afraid of him.
contents: When a prophet speaks in the name of the LORD and the message does not come to pass or come true, that is a message the LORD has not spoken. The prophet has spoken presumptuously. Do not be afraid of him.

contents.verseText: When the LORD your God has cut off the nations whose land He is giving you, and when you have driven them out and settled in their cities and houses,
contents: When the LORD your God has cut off the nations whose land He is giving you, and when you have driven them out and settled in their cities and houses,

contents.verseText: then you are to set apart for yourselves three cities within the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.
contents: then you are to set apart for yourselves three cities within the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.

contents.verseText: You are to build roads for yourselves and divide into three regions the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, so that any manslayer can flee to these cities.
contents: You are to build roads for yourselves

footnote.ft: Or You are to survey the way

contents: and divide into three regions the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, so that any manslayer can flee to these cities.

contents.verseText: Now this is the situation regarding the manslayer who flees to one of these cities to save his life, having killed his neighbor accidentally, without intending to harm him:
contents: Now this is the situation regarding the manslayer who flees to one of these cities to save his life, having killed his neighbor accidentally, without intending to harm him:

contents.verseText: If he goes into the forest with his neighbor to cut timber and swings his axe to chop down a tree, but the blade flies off the handle and strikes and kills his neighbor, he may flee to one of these cities to save his life.
contents: If he goes into the forest with his neighbor to cut timber and swings his axe to chop down a tree, but the blade flies off the handle and strikes and kills his neighbor, he may flee to one of these cities to save his life.

contents.verseText: Otherwise, the avenger of blood might pursue the manslayer in a rage, overtake him if the distance is great, and strike him dead though he did not deserve to die, since he did not intend any harm.
contents: Otherwise, the avenger of blood might pursue the manslayer in a rage, overtake him if the distance is great, and strike him dead though he did not deserve to die, since he did not intend any harm.

contents.verseText: This is why I am commanding you to set apart for yourselves three cities.
contents: This is why I am commanding you to set apart for yourselves three cities.

contents.verseText: And if the LORD your God enlarges your territory, as He swore to your fathers, and gives you all the land He promised them,
contents: And if the LORD your God enlarges your territory, as He swore to your fathers, and gives you all the land He promised them,

contents.verseText: and if you carefully keep all these commandments I am giving you today, loving the LORD your God and walking in His ways at all times, then you are to add three more cities to these three.
contents: and if you carefully keep all these commandments I am giving you today, loving the LORD your God and walking in His ways at all times, then you are to add three more cities to these three.

contents.verseText: Thus innocent blood will not be shed in the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, so that you will not be guilty of bloodshed.
