contents: Thus innocent blood will not be shed in the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, so that you will not be guilty of bloodshed.

contents.verseText: If, however, a man hates his neighbor and lies in wait, attacks him and kills him, and then flees to one of these cities,
contents: If, however, a man hates his neighbor and lies in wait, attacks him and kills him, and then flees to one of these cities,

contents.verseText: the elders of his city must send for him, bring him back, and hand him over to the avenger of blood to die.
contents: the elders of his city must send for him, bring him back, and hand him over to the avenger of blood to die.

contents.verseText: You must show him no pity. You are to purge from Israel the guilt of shedding innocent blood, that it may go well with you.
contents: You must show him no pity. You are to purge from Israel the guilt of shedding innocent blood, that it may go well with you.

contents.verseText: You must not move your neighbor’s boundary marker, which was set up by your ancestors to mark the inheritance you shall receive in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.
contents: You must not move your neighbor’s boundary marker, which was set up by your ancestors to mark the inheritance you shall receive in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess.

s1: The Testimony of Two or Three Witnesses

contents.verseText: A lone witness is not sufficient to establish any wrongdoing or sin against a man, regardless of what offense he may have committed. A matter must be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.
contents: A lone witness is not sufficient to establish any wrongdoing or sin against a man, regardless of what offense he may have committed. A matter must be established by the testimony of two or three witnesses.

footnote.ft: Cited in Matthew 18:16 and 2 Corinthians 13:1

contents.verseText: If a false witness testifies against someone, accusing him of a crime,
contents: If a false witness testifies against someone, accusing him of a crime,

contents.verseText: both parties to the dispute must stand in the presence of the LORD, before the priests and judges who are in office at that time.
contents: both parties to the dispute must stand in the presence of the LORD, before the priests and judges who are in office at that time.

contents.verseText: The judges shall investigate thoroughly, and if the witness is proven to be a liar who has falsely accused his brother,
contents: The judges shall investigate thoroughly, and if the witness is proven to be a liar who has falsely accused his brother,

contents.verseText: you must do to him as he intended to do to his brother. So you must purge the evil from among you.
contents: you must do to him as he intended to do to his brother. So you must purge the evil from among you.

footnote.ft: Cited in 1 Corinthians 5:13

contents.verseText: Then the rest of the people will hear and be afraid, and they will never again do anything so evil among you.
contents: Then the rest of the people will hear and be afraid, and they will never again do anything so evil among you.

contents.verseText: You must show no pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, and foot for foot.
contents: You must show no pity: life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth,

footnote.ft: Cited in Matthew 5:38

contents: hand for hand, and foot for foot.

contents.verseText: When you go out to war against your enemies and see horses, chariots, and an army larger than yours, do not be afraid of them; for the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, is with you.
contents: When you go out to war against your enemies and see horses, chariots, and an army larger than yours, do not be afraid of them; for the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, is with you.

contents.verseText: When you are about to go into battle, the priest is to come forward and address the army,
contents: When you are about to go into battle, the priest is to come forward and address the army,

contents.verseText: saying to them, “Hear, O Israel, today you are going into battle with your enemies. Do not be fainthearted or afraid; do not be alarmed or terrified because of them.
contents: saying to them, “Hear, O Israel, today you are going into battle with your enemies. Do not be fainthearted or afraid; do not be alarmed or terrified because of them.

contents.verseText: For the LORD your God goes with you to fight for you against your enemies, to give you the victory.”
contents: For the LORD your God goes with you to fight for you against your enemies, to give you the victory.”

contents.verseText: Furthermore, the officers are to address the army, saying, “Has any man built a new house and not dedicated it? Let him return home, or he may die in battle and another man dedicate it.
contents: Furthermore, the officers are to address the army, saying, “Has any man built a new house and not dedicated it? Let him return home, or he may die in battle and another man dedicate it.

contents.verseText: Has any man planted a vineyard and not begun to enjoy its fruit? Let him return home, or he may die in battle and another man enjoy its fruit.
contents: Has any man planted a vineyard and not begun to enjoy its fruit? Let him return home, or he may die in battle and another man enjoy its fruit.

contents.verseText: Has any man become pledged to a woman and not married her? Let him return home, or he may die in battle and another man marry her.”
contents: Has any man become pledged to a woman and not married her? Let him return home, or he may die in battle and another man marry her.”

contents.verseText: Then the officers shall speak further to the army, saying, “Is any man afraid or fainthearted? Let him return home, so that the hearts of his brothers will not melt like his own.”
contents: Then the officers shall speak further to the army, saying, “Is any man afraid or fainthearted? Let him return home, so that the hearts of his brothers will not melt like his own.”

contents.verseText: When the officers have finished addressing the army, they are to appoint commanders to lead it.
contents: When the officers have finished addressing the army, they are to appoint commanders to lead it.

contents.verseText: When you approach a city to fight against it, you are to make an offer of peace.
contents: When you approach a city to fight against it, you are to make an offer of peace.

contents.verseText: If they accept your offer of peace and open their gates, all the people there will become forced laborers to serve you.
contents: If they accept your offer of peace and open their gates, all the people there will become forced laborers to serve you.

contents.verseText: But if they refuse to make peace with you and wage war against you, lay siege to that city.
contents: But if they refuse to make peace with you and wage war against you, lay siege to that city.

contents.verseText: When the LORD your God has delivered it into your hand, you must put every male to the sword.
contents: When the LORD your God has delivered it into your hand, you must put every male to the sword.

contents.verseText: But the women, children, livestock, and whatever else is in the city—all its spoil—you may take as plunder, and you shall use the spoil of your enemies that the LORD your God gives you.
contents: But the women, children, livestock, and whatever else is in the city—all its spoil—you may take as plunder, and you shall use the spoil of your enemies that the LORD your God gives you.

contents.verseText: This is how you are to treat all the cities that are far away from you and do not belong to the nations nearby.
contents: This is how you are to treat all the cities that are far away from you and do not belong to the nations nearby.

contents.verseText: However, in the cities of the nations that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, you must not leave alive anything that breathes.
contents: However, in the cities of the nations that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, you must not leave alive anything that breathes.

contents.verseText: For you must devote them to complete destruction—the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites—as the LORD your God has commanded you,
contents: For you must devote them to complete destruction

footnote.ft: Forms of the Hebrew cherem refer to the giving over of things or persons to the LORD, either by destroying them or by giving them as an offering.

contents: —the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites—as the LORD your God has commanded you,

contents.verseText: so that they cannot teach you to do all the detestable things they do for their gods, and so cause you to sin against the LORD your God.
contents: so that they cannot teach you to do all the detestable things they do for their gods, and so cause you to sin against the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: When you lay siege to a city for an extended time while fighting against it to capture it, you must not destroy its trees by putting an axe to them, because you can eat their fruit. You must not cut them down. Are the trees of the field human, that you should besiege them?
contents: When you lay siege to a city for an extended time while fighting against it to capture it, you must not destroy its trees by putting an axe to them, because you can eat their fruit. You must not cut them down. Are the trees of the field human, that you should besiege them?

contents.verseText: But you may destroy the trees that you know do not produce fruit. Use them to build siege works against the city that is waging war against you, until it falls.
contents: But you may destroy the trees that you know do not produce fruit. Use them to build siege works against the city that is waging war against you, until it falls.

contents.verseText: If one is found slain, lying in a field in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess, and it is not known who killed him,
contents: If one is found slain, lying in a field in the land that the LORD your God is giving you to possess, and it is not known who killed him,

contents.verseText: your elders and judges must come out and measure the distance from the victim to the neighboring cities.
contents: your elders and judges must come out and measure the distance from the victim to the neighboring cities.

contents.verseText: Then the elders of the city nearest the victim shall take a heifer that has never been yoked or used for work,
contents: Then the elders of the city nearest the victim shall take a heifer that has never been yoked or used for work,

contents.verseText: bring the heifer to a valley with running water that has not been plowed or sown, and break its neck there by the stream.
contents: bring the heifer to a valley with running water that has not been plowed or sown, and break its neck there by the stream.

contents.verseText: And the priests, the sons of Levi, shall come forward, for the LORD your God has chosen them to serve Him and pronounce blessings in His name and to give a ruling in every dispute and case of assault.
contents: And the priests, the sons of Levi, shall come forward, for the LORD your God has chosen them to serve Him and pronounce blessings in His name and to give a ruling in every dispute and case of assault.

contents.verseText: Then all the elders of the city nearest the victim shall wash their hands by the stream over the heifer whose neck has been broken,
contents: Then all the elders of the city nearest the victim shall wash their hands by the stream over the heifer whose neck has been broken,

contents.verseText: and they shall declare, “Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes see it.
contents: and they shall declare, “Our hands did not shed this blood, nor did our eyes see it.

contents.verseText: Accept this atonement, O LORD, for Your people Israel whom You have redeemed, and do not hold the shedding of innocent blood against them.” And the bloodshed will be atoned for.
contents: Accept this atonement, O LORD, for Your people Israel whom You have redeemed, and do not hold the shedding of innocent blood against them.”
And the bloodshed will be atoned for.

contents.verseText: So you shall purge from among you the guilt of shedding innocent blood, since you have done what is right in the eyes of the LORD.
contents: So you shall purge from among you the guilt of shedding innocent blood, since you have done what is right in the eyes of the LORD.

contents.verseText: When you go to war against your enemies and the LORD your God delivers them into your hand and you take them captive,
contents: When you go to war against your enemies and the LORD your God delivers them into your hand and you take them captive,

contents.verseText: if you see a beautiful woman among them, and you desire her and want to take her as your wife,
contents: if you see a beautiful woman among them, and you desire her and want to take her as your wife,

contents.verseText: then you shall bring her into your house. She must shave her head, trim her nails,
contents: then you shall bring her into your house. She must shave her head, trim her nails,

contents.verseText: and put aside the clothing of her captivity. After she has lived in your house a full month and mourned her father and mother, you may have relations with her and be her husband, and she shall be your wife.
contents: and put aside the clothing of her captivity.
After she has lived in your house a full month and mourned her father and mother, you may have relations with her and be her husband, and she shall be your wife.

contents.verseText: And if you are not pleased with her, you are to let her go wherever she wishes. But you must not sell her for money or treat her as a slave, since you have dishonored her.
contents: And if you are not pleased with her, you are to let her go wherever she wishes. But you must not sell her for money or treat her as a slave, since you have dishonored her.

contents.verseText: If a man has two wives, one beloved and the other unloved, and both bear him sons, but the unloved wife has the firstborn son,
contents: If a man has two wives, one beloved and the other unloved, and both bear him sons, but the unloved wife has the firstborn son,

contents.verseText: when that man assigns his inheritance to his sons he must not appoint the son of the beloved wife as the firstborn over the son of the unloved wife.
contents: when that man assigns his inheritance to his sons he must not appoint the son of the beloved wife as the firstborn over the son of the unloved wife.

contents.verseText: Instead, he must acknowledge the firstborn, the son of his unloved wife, by giving him a double portion of all that he has. For that son is the firstfruits of his father’s strength; the right of the firstborn belongs to him.
contents: Instead, he must acknowledge the firstborn, the son of his unloved wife, by giving him a double portion of all that he has. For that son is the firstfruits of his father’s strength; the right of the firstborn belongs to him.

contents.verseText: If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son who does not obey his father and mother and does not listen to them when disciplined,
contents: If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son who does not obey his father and mother and does not listen to them when disciplined,

contents.verseText: his father and mother are to lay hold of him and bring him to the elders of his city, to the gate of his hometown,
contents: his father and mother are to lay hold of him and bring him to the elders of his city, to the gate of his hometown,

contents.verseText: and say to the elders, “This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious; he does not obey us. He is a glutton and a drunkard.”
contents: and say to the elders, “This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious; he does not obey us. He is a glutton and a drunkard.”

contents.verseText: Then all the men of his city will stone him to death. So you must purge the evil from among you, and all Israel will hear and be afraid.
contents: Then all the men of his city will stone him to death. So you must purge the evil from among you,

footnote.ft: Cited in 1 Corinthians 5:13

contents: and all Israel will hear and be afraid.

s1: Cursed Is Anyone Hung on a Tree

contents.verseText: If a man has committed a sin worthy of death, and he is executed, and you hang his body on a tree,
contents: If a man has committed a sin worthy of death, and he is executed, and you hang his body on a tree,

footnote.ft: Or impale his body on a pole; similarly in verse 23

contents.verseText: you must not leave the body on the tree overnight, but you must be sure to bury him that day, because anyone who is hung on a tree is under God’s curse. You must not defile the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.
contents: you must not leave the body on the tree overnight, but you must be sure to bury him that day, because anyone who is hung on a tree is under God’s curse.

footnote.ft: LXX; Hebrew anyone who is hanged is under God’s curse; cited in Galatians 3:13

contents: You must not defile the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.

contents.verseText: If you see your brother’s ox or sheep straying, you must not ignore it; be sure to return it to your brother.
contents: If you see your brother’s ox or sheep straying, you must not ignore it;

footnote.ft: Or you must not hide yourself

contents: be sure to return it to your brother.

contents.verseText: If your brother does not live near you, or if you do not know who he is, you are to take the animal home to remain with you until your brother comes seeking it; then you can return it to him.
contents: If your brother does not live near you, or if you do not know who he is, you are to take the animal home to remain with you until your brother comes seeking it; then you can return it to him.

contents.verseText: And you shall do the same for his donkey, his cloak, or anything your brother has lost and you have found. You must not ignore it.
contents: And you shall do the same for his donkey, his cloak, or anything your brother has lost and you have found. You must not ignore it.

contents.verseText: If you see your brother’s donkey or ox fallen on the road, you must not ignore it; you must help him lift it up.
contents: If you see your brother’s donkey or ox fallen on the road, you must not ignore it; you must help him lift it up.

contents.verseText: A woman must not wear men’s clothing, and a man must not wear women’s clothing, for whoever does these things is detestable to the LORD your God.
contents: A woman must not wear men’s clothing, and a man must not wear women’s clothing, for whoever does these things is detestable to the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: If you come across a bird’s nest with chicks or eggs, either in a tree or on the ground along the road, and the mother is sitting on the chicks or eggs, you must not take the mother along with the young.
contents: If you come across a bird’s nest with chicks or eggs, either in a tree or on the ground along the road, and the mother is sitting on the chicks or eggs, you must not take the mother along with the young.

contents.verseText: You may take the young, but be sure to let the mother go, so that it may be well with you and that you may prolong your days.
contents: You may take the young, but be sure to let the mother go, so that it may be well with you and that you may prolong your days.

contents.verseText: If you build a new house, you are to construct a railing around your roof, so that you do not bring bloodguilt on your house if someone falls from it.
contents: If you build a new house, you are to construct a railing around your roof, so that you do not bring bloodguilt on your house if someone falls from it.

contents.verseText: Do not plant your vineyard with two types of seed; if you do, the entire harvest will be defiled—both the crop you plant and the fruit of your vineyard.
contents: Do not plant your vineyard with two types of seed; if you do, the entire harvest will be defiled

footnote.ft: Or will be forfeited to the sanctuary

contents: —both the crop you plant and the fruit of your vineyard.

contents.verseText: Do not plow with an ox and a donkey yoked together.
contents: Do not plow with an ox and a donkey yoked together.

contents.verseText: Do not wear clothes of wool and linen woven together.
contents: Do not wear clothes of wool and linen woven together.

contents.verseText: You are to make tassels on the four corners of the cloak you wear.
contents: You are to make tassels on the four corners of the cloak you wear.

contents.verseText: Suppose a man marries a woman, has relations with her, and comes to hate her,
contents: Suppose a man marries a woman, has relations with her, and comes to hate her,

contents.verseText: and he then accuses her of shameful conduct and gives her a bad name, saying, “I married this woman and had relations with her, but I discovered she was not a virgin.”
contents: and he then accuses her of shameful conduct and gives her a bad name, saying, “I married this woman and had relations with her, but I discovered she was not a virgin.”

contents.verseText: Then the young woman’s father and mother shall bring the proof of her virginity to the city elders at the gate
contents: Then the young woman’s father and mother shall bring the proof of her virginity to the city elders at the gate

contents.verseText: and say to the elders, “I gave my daughter in marriage to this man, but he has come to hate her.
contents: and say to the elders, “I gave my daughter in marriage to this man, but he has come to hate her.

contents.verseText: And now he has accused her of shameful conduct, saying, ‘I discovered that your daughter was not a virgin.’ But here is the proof of her virginity.” And they shall spread out the cloth before the city elders.
contents: And now he has accused her of shameful conduct, saying, ‘I discovered that your daughter was not a virgin.’ But here is the proof of her virginity.” And they shall spread out the cloth before the city elders.

contents.verseText: Then the elders of that city shall take the man and punish him.
contents: Then the elders of that city shall take the man and punish him.

contents.verseText: They are also to fine him a hundred shekels of silver and give them to the young woman’s father, because this man has given a virgin of Israel a bad name. And she shall remain his wife; he must not divorce her as long as he lives.
contents: They are also to fine him a hundred shekels of silver

footnote.ft: 100 shekels is approximately 2.5 pounds or 1.1 kilograms of silver.

contents: and give them to the young woman’s father, because this man has given a virgin of Israel a bad name. And she shall remain his wife; he must not divorce her as long as he lives.

contents.verseText: If, however, this accusation is true, and no proof of the young woman’s virginity can be found,
contents: If, however, this accusation is true, and no proof of the young woman’s virginity can be found,

contents.verseText: she shall be brought to the door of her father’s house, and there the men of her city will stone her to death. For she has committed an outrage in Israel by being promiscuous in her father’s house. So you must purge the evil from among you.
contents: she shall be brought to the door of her father’s house, and there the men of her city will stone her to death. For she has committed an outrage in Israel by being promiscuous in her father’s house. So you must purge the evil from among you.

footnote.ft: Here and in verse 24; cited in 1 Corinthians 5:13

contents.verseText: If a man is found lying with another man’s wife, both the man who slept with her and the woman must die. You must purge the evil from Israel.
contents: If a man is found lying with another man’s wife, both the man who slept with her and the woman must die. You must purge the evil from Israel.

contents.verseText: If there is a virgin pledged in marriage to a man, and another man encounters her in the city and sleeps with her,
contents: If there is a virgin pledged in marriage to a man, and another man encounters her in the city and sleeps with her,

contents.verseText: you must take both of them out to the gate of that city and stone them to death—the young woman because she did not cry out in the city, and the man because he has violated his neighbor’s wife. So you must purge the evil from among you.
contents: you must take both of them out to the gate of that city and stone them to death—the young woman because she did not cry out in the city, and the man because he has violated his neighbor’s wife. So you must purge the evil from among you.

contents.verseText: But if the man encounters a betrothed woman in the open country, and he overpowers her and lies with her, only the man who has done this must die.
contents: But if the man encounters a betrothed woman in the open country, and he overpowers her and lies with her, only the man who has done this must die.

contents.verseText: Do nothing to the young woman, because she has committed no sin worthy of death. This case is just like one in which a man attacks his neighbor and murders him.
contents: Do nothing to the young woman, because she has committed no sin worthy of death. This case is just like one in which a man attacks his neighbor and murders him.

contents.verseText: When he found her in the field, the betrothed woman cried out, but there was no one to save her.
contents: When he found her in the field, the betrothed woman cried out, but there was no one to save her.

contents.verseText: If a man encounters a virgin who is not pledged in marriage, and he seizes her and lies with her, and they are discovered,
contents: If a man encounters a virgin who is not pledged in marriage, and he seizes her and lies with her, and they are discovered,

contents.verseText: then the man who lay with her must pay the young woman’s father fifty shekels of silver, and she must become his wife because he has violated her. He must not divorce her as long as he lives.
contents: then the man who lay with her must pay the young woman’s father fifty shekels of silver,

footnote.ft: 50 shekels is approximately 1.26 pounds or 569.8 grams of silver.

contents: and she must become his wife because he has violated her. He must not divorce her as long as he lives.

contents.verseText: A man is not to marry his father’s wife, so that he will not dishonor his father’s marriage bed.
contents: A man is not to marry his father’s wife, so that he will not dishonor his father’s marriage bed.

footnote.ft: Or uncover his father’s skirt

contents.verseText: No man with crushed or severed genitals may enter the assembly of the LORD.
contents: No man with crushed or severed genitals may enter the assembly of the LORD.

contents.verseText: No one of illegitimate birth may enter the assembly of the LORD, nor may any of his descendants, even to the tenth generation.
contents: No one of illegitimate birth may enter the assembly of the LORD, nor may any of his descendants, even to the tenth generation.

contents.verseText: No Ammonite or Moabite or any of their descendants may enter the assembly of the LORD, even to the tenth generation.
contents: No Ammonite or Moabite or any of their descendants may enter the assembly of the LORD, even to the tenth generation.

contents.verseText: For they did not meet you with food and water on your way out of Egypt, and they hired Balaam son of Beor from Pethor in Aram-naharaim to curse you.
contents: For they did not meet you with food and water on your way out of Egypt, and they hired Balaam son of Beor from Pethor in Aram-naharaim

footnote.ft: That is, Mesopotamia; Aram-naharaim means Aram of the two rivers, likely the region between the Euphrates and Balih Rivers in northwestern Mesopotamia.

contents: to curse you.

contents.verseText: Yet the LORD your God would not listen to Balaam, and the LORD your God turned the curse into a blessing for you, because the LORD your God loves you.
contents: Yet the LORD your God would not listen to Balaam, and the LORD your God turned the curse into a blessing for you, because the LORD your God loves you.

contents.verseText: You are not to seek peace or prosperity from them as long as you live.
contents: You are not to seek peace or prosperity from them as long as you live.

contents.verseText: Do not despise an Edomite, for he is your brother. Do not despise an Egyptian, because you lived as a foreigner in his land.
contents: Do not despise an Edomite, for he is your brother. Do not despise an Egyptian, because you lived as a foreigner in his land.

contents.verseText: The third generation of children born to them may enter the assembly of the LORD.
contents: The third generation of children born to them may enter the assembly of the LORD.

contents.verseText: When you are encamped against your enemies, then you shall keep yourself from every wicked thing.
contents: When you are encamped against your enemies, then you shall keep yourself from every wicked thing.

contents.verseText: If any man among you becomes unclean because of a nocturnal emission, he must leave the camp and stay outside.
contents: If any man among you becomes unclean because of a nocturnal emission, he must leave the camp and stay outside.

contents.verseText: When evening approaches, he must wash with water, and when the sun sets he may return to the camp.
contents: When evening approaches, he must wash with water, and when the sun sets he may return to the camp.

contents.verseText: You must have a place outside the camp to go and relieve yourself.
contents: You must have a place outside the camp to go and relieve yourself.

contents.verseText: And you must have a digging tool in your equipment so that when you relieve yourself you can dig a hole and cover up your excrement.
contents: And you must have a digging tool in your equipment so that when you relieve yourself you can dig a hole and cover up your excrement.

contents.verseText: For the LORD your God walks throughout your camp to protect you and deliver your enemies to you. Your camp must be holy, lest He see anything unclean among you and turn away from you.
contents: For the LORD your God walks throughout your camp to protect you and deliver your enemies to you. Your camp must be holy, lest He see anything unclean among you and turn away from you.

contents.verseText: Do not return a slave to his master if he has taken refuge with you.
contents: Do not return a slave to his master if he has taken refuge with you.

contents.verseText: Let him live among you wherever he chooses, in the town of his pleasing. Do not oppress him.
contents: Let him live among you wherever he chooses, in the town of his pleasing. Do not oppress him.

contents.verseText: No daughter or son of Israel is to be a shrine prostitute.
contents: No daughter or son of Israel is to be a shrine prostitute.

contents.verseText: You must not bring the wages of a prostitute, whether female or male, into the house of the LORD your God to fulfill any vow, because both are detestable to the LORD your God.
contents: You must not bring the wages of a prostitute, whether female or male,

footnote.ft: Hebrew or a dog

contents: into the house of the LORD your God to fulfill any vow, because both are detestable to the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: Do not charge your brother interest on money, food, or any other type of loan.
contents: Do not charge your brother interest on money, food, or any other type of loan.

contents.verseText: You may charge a foreigner interest, but not your brother, so that the LORD your God may bless you in everything to which you put your hand in the land that you are entering to possess.
contents: You may charge a foreigner interest, but not your brother, so that the LORD your God may bless you in everything to which you put your hand in the land that you are entering to possess.

contents.verseText: If you make a vow to the LORD your God, do not be slow to keep it, because He will surely require it of you, and you will be guilty of sin.
contents: If you make a vow to the LORD your God, do not be slow to keep it, because He will surely require it of you, and you will be guilty of sin.

contents.verseText: But if you refrain from making a vow, you will not be guilty of sin.
contents: But if you refrain from making a vow, you will not be guilty of sin.

contents.verseText: Be careful to follow through on what comes from your lips, because you have freely vowed to the LORD your God with your own mouth.
contents: Be careful to follow through on what comes from your lips, because you have freely vowed to the LORD your God with your own mouth.

contents.verseText: When you enter your neighbor’s vineyard, you may eat your fill of grapes, but you must not put any in your basket.
contents: When you enter your neighbor’s vineyard, you may eat your fill of grapes, but you must not put any in your basket.

contents.verseText: When you enter your neighbor’s grainfield, you may pluck the heads of grain with your hand, but you must not put a sickle to your neighbor’s grain.
contents: When you enter your neighbor’s grainfield, you may pluck the heads of grain with your hand, but you must not put a sickle to your neighbor’s grain.

contents.verseText: If a man marries a woman, but she becomes displeasing to him because he finds some indecency in her, he may write her a certificate of divorce, hand it to her, and send her away from his house.
contents: If a man marries a woman, but she becomes displeasing to him because he finds some indecency in her, he may write her a certificate of divorce,

footnote.ft: Cited in Matthew 5:31; see also Mark 10:4.

contents: hand it to her, and send her away from his house.

contents.verseText: If, after leaving his house, she goes and becomes another man’s wife,
contents: If, after leaving his house, she goes and becomes another man’s wife,

contents.verseText: and the second man hates her, writes her a certificate of divorce, hands it to her, and sends her away from his house, or if he dies,
contents: and the second man hates her, writes her a certificate of divorce, hands it to her, and sends her away from his house, or if he dies,

contents.verseText: then the husband who divorced her first may not remarry her after she has been defiled, for that is an abomination to the LORD. You must not bring sin upon the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.
contents: then the husband who divorced her first may not remarry her after she has been defiled, for that is an abomination to the LORD. You must not bring sin upon the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.

contents.verseText: If a man is newly married, he must not be sent to war or be pressed into any duty. For one year he is free to stay at home and bring joy to the wife he has married.
contents: If a man is newly married, he must not be sent to war or be pressed into any duty. For one year he is free to stay at home and bring joy to the wife he has married.

contents.verseText: Do not take a pair of millstones or even an upper millstone as security for a debt, because that would be taking one’s livelihood as security.
contents: Do not take a pair of millstones or even an upper millstone as security for a debt, because that would be taking one’s livelihood as security.

contents.verseText: If a man is caught kidnapping one of his Israelite brothers, whether he treats him as a slave or sells him, the kidnapper must die. So you must purge the evil from among you.
contents: If a man is caught kidnapping one of his Israelite brothers, whether he treats him as a slave or sells him, the kidnapper must die. So you must purge the evil from among you.

footnote.ft: Cited in 1 Corinthians 5:13

contents.verseText: In cases of infectious skin diseases, be careful to diligently follow everything the Levitical priests instruct you. Be careful to do as I have commanded them.
contents: In cases of infectious skin diseases,

footnote.ft: Forms of the Hebrew tzaraath, traditionally translated as leprosy, were used for various skin diseases; see Leviticus 13.

contents: be careful to diligently follow everything the Levitical priests instruct you. Be careful to do as I have commanded them.

contents.verseText: Remember what the LORD your God did to Miriam on the journey after you came out of Egypt.
contents: Remember what the LORD your God did to Miriam on the journey after you came out of Egypt.

contents.verseText: When you lend anything to your neighbor, do not enter his house to collect security.
contents: When you lend anything to your neighbor, do not enter his house to collect security.

contents.verseText: You are to stand outside while the man to whom you are lending brings the security out to you.
contents: You are to stand outside while the man to whom you are lending brings the security out to you.

contents.verseText: If he is a poor man, you must not go to sleep with the security in your possession;
contents: If he is a poor man, you must not go to sleep with the security in your possession;

contents.verseText: be sure to return it to him by sunset, so that he may sleep in his own cloak and bless you, and this will be credited to you as righteousness before the LORD your God.
contents: be sure to return it to him by sunset, so that he may sleep in his own cloak and bless you, and this will be credited to you as righteousness before the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: Do not oppress a hired hand who is poor and needy, whether he is a brother or a foreigner residing in one of your towns.
contents: Do not oppress a hired hand who is poor and needy, whether he is a brother or a foreigner residing in one of your towns.

contents.verseText: You are to pay his wages each day before sunset, because he is poor and depends on them. Otherwise he may cry out to the LORD against you, and you will be guilty of sin.
contents: You are to pay his wages each day before sunset, because he is poor and depends on them. Otherwise he may cry out to the LORD against you, and you will be guilty of sin.

contents.verseText: Fathers shall not be put to death for their children, nor children for their fathers; each is to die for his own sin.
contents: Fathers shall not be put to death for their children, nor children for their fathers; each is to die for his own sin.

footnote.ft: Cited in 2 Kings 14:6 and 2 Chronicles 25:4

contents.verseText: Do not deny justice to the foreigner or the fatherless, and do not take a widow’s cloak as security.
contents: Do not deny justice to the foreigner or the fatherless, and do not take a widow’s cloak as security.

contents.verseText: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt, and the LORD your God redeemed you from that place. Therefore I am commanding you to do this.
contents: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt, and the LORD your God redeemed you from that place. Therefore I am commanding you to do this.

contents.verseText: If you are harvesting in your field and forget a sheaf there, do not go back to get it. It is to be left for the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, so that the LORD your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.
contents: If you are harvesting in your field and forget a sheaf there, do not go back to get it. It is to be left for the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, so that the LORD your God may bless you in all the work of your hands.

contents.verseText: When you beat the olives from your trees, you must not go over the branches again. What remains will be for the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow.
contents: When you beat the olives from your trees, you must not go over the branches again. What remains will be for the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow.

contents.verseText: When you gather the grapes of your vineyard, you must not go over the vines again. What remains will be for the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow.
contents: When you gather the grapes of your vineyard, you must not go over the vines again. What remains will be for the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow.

contents.verseText: Remember that you were slaves in the land of Egypt. Therefore I am commanding you to do this.
contents: Remember that you were slaves in the land of Egypt. Therefore I am commanding you to do this.

contents.verseText: If there is a dispute between men, they are to go to court to be judged, so that the innocent may be acquitted and the guilty condemned.
contents: If there is a dispute between men, they are to go to court to be judged, so that the innocent may be acquitted and the guilty condemned.

contents.verseText: If the guilty man deserves to be beaten, the judge shall have him lie down and be flogged in his presence with the number of lashes his crime warrants.
contents: If the guilty man deserves to be beaten, the judge shall have him lie down and be flogged in his presence with the number of lashes his crime warrants.

contents.verseText: He may receive no more than forty lashes, lest your brother be beaten any more than that and be degraded in your sight.
contents: He may receive no more than forty lashes, lest your brother be beaten any more than that and be degraded in your sight.

contents.verseText: Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain.
contents: Do not muzzle an ox while it is treading out the grain.

footnote.ft: Cited in 1 Corinthians 9:9 and 1 Timothy 5:18

contents.verseText: When brothers dwell together and one of them dies without a son, the widow must not marry outside the family. Her husband’s brother is to take her as his wife and fulfill the duty of a brother-in-law for her.
contents: When brothers dwell together and one of them dies without a son, the widow must not marry outside the family. Her husband’s brother is to take her as his wife and fulfill the duty of a brother-in-law for her.

footnote.ft: Cited in Matthew 22:24, Mark 12:19, and Luke 20:28

contents.verseText: The first son she bears will carry on the name of the dead brother, so that his name will not be blotted out from Israel.
contents: The first son she bears will carry on the name of the dead brother, so that his name will not be blotted out from Israel.

contents.verseText: But if the man does not want to marry his brother’s widow, she is to go to the elders at the city gate and say, “My husband’s brother refuses to preserve his brother’s name in Israel. He is not willing to perform the duty of a brother-in-law for me.”
contents: But if the man does not want to marry his brother’s widow, she is to go to the elders at the city gate and say, “My husband’s brother refuses to preserve his brother’s name in Israel. He is not willing to perform the duty of a brother-in-law for me.”

contents.verseText: Then the elders of his city shall summon him and speak with him. If he persists and says, “I do not want to marry her,”
contents: Then the elders of his city shall summon him and speak with him. If he persists and says, “I do not want to marry her,”

contents.verseText: his brother’s widow shall go up to him in the presence of the elders, remove his sandal, spit in his face, and declare, “This is what is done to the man who will not maintain his brother’s line.”
contents: his brother’s widow shall go up to him in the presence of the elders, remove his sandal, spit in his face, and declare, “This is what is done to the man who will not maintain his brother’s line.”

contents.verseText: And his family name in Israel will be called “The House of the Unsandaled.”
contents: And his family name in Israel will be called “The House of the Unsandaled.”

contents.verseText: If two men are fighting, and the wife of one steps in to rescue her husband from the one striking him, and she reaches out her hand and grabs his genitals,
contents: If two men are fighting, and the wife of one steps in to rescue her husband from the one striking him, and she reaches out her hand and grabs his genitals,

contents.verseText: you are to cut off her hand. You must show her no pity.
contents: you are to cut off her hand. You must show her no pity.

contents.verseText: You shall not have two differing weights in your bag, one heavy and one light.
contents: You shall not have two differing weights in your bag, one heavy and one light.

contents.verseText: You shall not have two differing measures in your house, one large and one small.
contents: You shall not have two differing measures in your house, one large and one small.

contents.verseText: You must maintain accurate and honest weights and measures, so that you may live long in the land that the LORD your God is giving you.
contents: You must maintain accurate and honest weights and measures, so that you may live long in the land that the LORD your God is giving you.

contents.verseText: For everyone who behaves dishonestly in regard to these things is detestable to the LORD your God.
contents: For everyone who behaves dishonestly in regard to these things is detestable to the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: Remember what the Amalekites did to you along your way from Egypt,
contents: Remember what the Amalekites did to you along your way from Egypt,

contents.verseText: how they met you on your journey when you were tired and weary, and they attacked all your stragglers; they had no fear of God.
contents: how they met you on your journey when you were tired and weary, and they attacked all your stragglers; they had no fear of God.

contents.verseText: When the LORD your God gives you rest from the enemies around you in the land that He is giving you to possess as an inheritance, you are to blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven. Do not forget!
contents: When the LORD your God gives you rest from the enemies around you in the land that He is giving you to possess as an inheritance, you are to blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven. Do not forget!

contents.verseText: When you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, and you take possession of it and settle in it,
contents: When you enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance, and you take possession of it and settle in it,

contents.verseText: you are to take some of the firstfruits of all your produce from the soil of the land that the LORD your God is giving you and put them in a basket. Then go to the place the LORD your God will choose as a dwelling for His Name,
contents: you are to take some of the firstfruits of all your produce from the soil of the land that the LORD your God is giving you and put them in a basket. Then go to the place the LORD your God will choose as a dwelling for His Name,

contents.verseText: to the priest who is serving at that time, and say to him, “I declare today to the LORD your God that I have entered the land that the LORD swore to our fathers to give us.”
contents: to the priest who is serving at that time, and say to him, “I declare today to the LORD your God that I have entered the land that the LORD swore to our fathers to give us.”

contents.verseText: Then the priest shall take the basket from your hands and place it before the altar of the LORD your God,
contents: Then the priest shall take the basket from your hands and place it before the altar of the LORD your God,

contents.verseText: and you are to declare before the LORD your God, “My father was a wandering Aramean, and he went down to Egypt few in number and lived there and became a great nation, mighty and numerous.
contents: and you are to declare before the LORD your God, “My father was a wandering Aramean, and he went down to Egypt few in number and lived there and became a great nation, mighty and numerous.

contents.verseText: But the Egyptians mistreated us and afflicted us, putting us to hard labor.
contents: But the Egyptians mistreated us and afflicted us, putting us to hard labor.

contents.verseText: So we called out to the LORD, the God of our fathers; and the LORD heard our voice and saw our affliction, toil, and oppression.
contents: So we called out to the LORD, the God of our fathers; and the LORD heard our voice and saw our affliction, toil, and oppression.

contents.verseText: Then the LORD brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, with great terror, signs, and wonders.
contents: Then the LORD brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, with great terror, signs, and wonders.

contents.verseText: And He brought us to this place and gave us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.
contents: And He brought us to this place and gave us this land, a land flowing with milk and honey.

contents.verseText: And now, behold, I have brought the firstfruits of the land that You, O LORD, have given me.” Then you are to place the basket before the LORD your God and bow down before Him.
contents: And now, behold, I have brought the firstfruits of the land that You, O LORD, have given me.”
Then you are to place the basket before the LORD your God and bow down before Him.

contents.verseText: So you shall rejoice—you, the Levite, and the foreigner dwelling among you—in all the good things the LORD your God has given to you and your household.
contents: So you shall rejoice—you, the Levite, and the foreigner dwelling among you—in all the good things the LORD your God has given to you and your household.

contents.verseText: When you have finished laying aside a tenth of all your produce in the third year, the year of the tithe, you are to give it to the Levite, the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, that they may eat and be filled within your gates.
contents: When you have finished laying aside a tenth of all your produce in the third year, the year of the tithe, you are to give it to the Levite, the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, that they may eat and be filled within your gates.

contents.verseText: Then you shall declare in the presence of the LORD your God, “I have removed from my house the sacred portion and have given it to the Levite, the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, according to all the commandments You have given me. I have not transgressed or forgotten Your commandments.
contents: Then you shall declare in the presence of the LORD your God, “I have removed from my house the sacred portion and have given it to the Levite, the foreigner, the fatherless, and the widow, according to all the commandments You have given me. I have not transgressed or forgotten Your commandments.

contents.verseText: I have not eaten any of the sacred portion while in mourning, or removed any of it while unclean, or offered any of it for the dead. I have obeyed the LORD my God; I have done everything You commanded me.
contents: I have not eaten any of the sacred portion while in mourning, or removed any of it while unclean, or offered any of it for the dead. I have obeyed the LORD my God; I have done everything You commanded me.

contents.verseText: Look down from Your holy habitation, from heaven, and bless Your people Israel and the land You have given us as You swore to our fathers—a land flowing with milk and honey.”
contents: Look down from Your holy habitation, from heaven, and bless Your people Israel and the land You have given us as You swore to our fathers—a land flowing with milk and honey.”

contents.verseText: The LORD your God commands you this day to follow these statutes and ordinances. You must be careful to follow them with all your heart and with all your soul.
contents: The LORD your God commands you this day to follow these statutes and ordinances. You must be careful to follow them with all your heart and with all your soul.

contents.verseText: Today you have proclaimed that the LORD is your God and that you will walk in His ways, keep His statutes and commandments and ordinances, and listen to His voice.
contents: Today you have proclaimed that the LORD is your God and that you will walk in His ways, keep His statutes and commandments and ordinances, and listen to His voice.

contents.verseText: And today the LORD has proclaimed that you are His people and treasured possession as He promised, that you are to keep all His commandments,
contents: And today the LORD has proclaimed that you are His people and treasured possession as He promised, that you are to keep all His commandments,

contents.verseText: that He will set you high in praise and name and honor above all the nations He has made, and that you will be a holy people to the LORD your God, as He has promised.
contents: that He will set you high in praise and name and honor above all the nations He has made, and that you will be a holy people to the LORD your God, as He has promised.

contents.verseText: Then Moses and the elders of Israel commanded the people: “Keep all the commandments I am giving you today.
contents: Then Moses and the elders of Israel commanded the people: “Keep all the commandments I am giving you today.

contents.verseText: And on the day you cross the Jordan into the land that the LORD your God is giving you, set up large stones and coat them with plaster.
contents: And on the day you cross the Jordan into the land that the LORD your God is giving you, set up large stones and coat them with plaster.

contents.verseText: Write on them all the words of this law when you have crossed over to enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey, just as the LORD, the God of your fathers, has promised you.
contents: Write on them all the words of this law when you have crossed over to enter the land that the LORD your God is giving you, a land flowing with milk and honey, just as the LORD, the God of your fathers, has promised you.

contents.verseText: And when you have crossed the Jordan, you are to set up these stones on Mount Ebal, as I am commanding you today, and you are to coat them with plaster.
contents: And when you have crossed the Jordan, you are to set up these stones on Mount Ebal, as I am commanding you today, and you are to coat them with plaster.

contents.verseText: Moreover, you are to build there an altar to the LORD your God, an altar of stones. You must not use any iron tool on them.
contents: Moreover, you are to build there an altar to the LORD your God, an altar of stones. You must not use any iron tool on them.

contents.verseText: You shall build the altar of the LORD your God with uncut stones and offer upon it burnt offerings to the LORD your God.
contents: You shall build the altar of the LORD your God with uncut stones and offer upon it burnt offerings to the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: There you are to sacrifice your peace offerings, eating them and rejoicing in the presence of the LORD your God.
contents: There you are to sacrifice your peace offerings, eating them and rejoicing in the presence of the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: And you shall write distinctly upon these stones all the words of this law.”
contents: And you shall write distinctly upon these stones all the words of this law.”

contents.verseText: Then Moses and the Levitical priests spoke to all Israel: “Be silent, O Israel, and listen! This day you have become the people of the LORD your God.
contents: Then Moses and the Levitical priests spoke to all Israel: “Be silent, O Israel, and listen! This day you have become the people of the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: You shall therefore obey the voice of the LORD your God and follow His commandments and statutes I am giving you today.”
contents: You shall therefore obey the voice of the LORD your God and follow His commandments and statutes I am giving you today.”

contents.verseText: On that day Moses commanded the people:
contents: On that day Moses commanded the people:

contents.verseText: “When you have crossed the Jordan, these tribes shall stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.
contents: “When you have crossed the Jordan, these tribes shall stand on Mount Gerizim to bless the people: Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin.

contents.verseText: And these tribes shall stand on Mount Ebal to deliver the curse: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
contents: And these tribes shall stand on Mount Ebal to deliver the curse: Reuben, Gad, Asher, Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.

contents.verseText: Then the Levites shall proclaim in a loud voice to every Israelite: 1
contents: Then the Levites shall proclaim in a loud voice to every Israelite:

contents.verseText: ‘Cursed is the man who makes a carved idol or molten image—an abomination to the LORD, the work of the hands of a craftsman—and sets it up in secret.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’ 1
contents: ‘Cursed is the man who makes a carved idol or molten image—an abomination to the LORD, the work of the hands of a craftsman—and sets it up in secret.’
And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’

contents.verseText: ‘Cursed is he who dishonors his father or mother.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’ 1
contents: ‘Cursed is he who dishonors his father or mother.’
And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’

contents.verseText: ‘Cursed is he who moves his neighbor’s boundary stone.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’ 1
contents: ‘Cursed is he who moves his neighbor’s boundary stone.’
And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’

contents.verseText: ‘Cursed is he who lets a blind man wander in the road.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’ 1
contents: ‘Cursed is he who lets a blind man wander in the road.’
And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’

contents.verseText: ‘Cursed is he who withholds justice from the foreigner, the fatherless, or the widow.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’ 1
contents: ‘Cursed is he who withholds justice from the foreigner, the fatherless, or the widow.’
And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’

contents.verseText: ‘Cursed is he who sleeps with his father’s wife, for he has violated his father’s marriage bed.’ And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’ 1
contents: ‘Cursed is he who sleeps with his father’s wife, for he has violated his father’s marriage bed.’

contents: And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’

contents: ‘Cursed is he who lies with any animal.’
And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’

contents: ‘Cursed is he who sleeps with his sister, the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother.’
And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’

contents: ‘Cursed is he who sleeps with his mother-in-law.’
And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’

contents: ‘Cursed is he who strikes down his neighbor in secret.’
And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’

contents: ‘Cursed is he who accepts a bribe to kill an innocent person.’
And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’

contents: ‘Cursed is he who does not put the words of this law into practice.’
