contents: And let all the people say, ‘Amen!’

contents.verseText: “Now if you faithfully obey the voice of the LORD your God and are careful to follow all His commandments I am giving you today, the LORD your God will set you high above all the nations of the earth.
contents: “Now if you faithfully obey the voice of the LORD your God and are careful to follow all His commandments I am giving you today, the LORD your God will set you high above all the nations of the earth.

contents.verseText: And all these blessings will come upon you and overtake you, if you will obey the voice of the LORD your God:
contents: And all these blessings will come upon you and overtake you, if you will obey the voice of the LORD your God:

contents.verseText: You will be blessed in the city and blessed in the country.
contents: You will be blessed in the city
and blessed in the country.

contents.verseText: The fruit of your womb will be blessed, as well as the produce of your land and the offspring of your livestock—the calves of your herds and the lambs of your flocks.
contents: The fruit of your womb will be blessed,
as well as the produce of your land
and the offspring of your livestock—
the calves of your herds
and the lambs of your flocks.

contents.verseText: Your basket and kneading bowl will be blessed.
contents: Your basket and kneading bowl will be blessed.

contents.verseText: You will be blessed when you come in and blessed when you go out.
contents: You will be blessed when you come in
and blessed when you go out.

contents.verseText: The LORD will cause the enemies who rise up against you to be defeated before you. They will march out against you in one direction but flee from you in seven.
contents: The LORD will cause the enemies who rise up against you to be defeated before you. They will march out against you in one direction but flee from you in seven.

contents.verseText: The LORD will decree a blessing on your barns and on everything to which you put your hand; the LORD your God will bless you in the land He is giving you.
contents: The LORD will decree a blessing on your barns and on everything to which you put your hand; the LORD your God will bless you in the land He is giving you.

contents.verseText: The LORD will establish you as His holy people, just as He has sworn to you, if you keep the commandments of the LORD your God and walk in His ways.
contents: The LORD will establish you as His holy people, just as He has sworn to you, if you keep the commandments of the LORD your God and walk in His ways.

contents.verseText: Then all the peoples of the earth will see that you are called by the name of the LORD, and they will stand in awe of you.
contents: Then all the peoples of the earth will see that you are called by the name of the LORD, and they will stand in awe of you.

contents.verseText: The LORD will make you prosper abundantly—in the fruit of your womb, the offspring of your livestock, and the produce of your land—in the land that the LORD swore to your fathers to give you.
contents: The LORD will make you prosper abundantly—in the fruit of your womb, the offspring of your livestock, and the produce of your land—in the land that the LORD swore to your fathers to give you.

contents.verseText: The LORD will open the heavens, His abundant storehouse, to send rain on your land in season and to bless all the work of your hands. You will lend to many nations, but borrow from none.
contents: The LORD will open the heavens, His abundant storehouse, to send rain on your land in season and to bless all the work of your hands. You will lend to many nations, but borrow from none.

contents.verseText: The LORD will make you the head and not the tail; you will only move upward and never downward, if you hear and carefully follow the commandments of the LORD your God, which I am giving you today.
contents: The LORD will make you the head and not the tail; you will only move upward and never downward, if you hear and carefully follow the commandments of the LORD your God, which I am giving you today.

contents.verseText: Do not turn aside to the right or to the left from any of the words I command you today, and do not go after other gods to serve them.
contents: Do not turn aside to the right or to the left from any of the words I command you today, and do not go after other gods to serve them.

contents.verseText: If, however, you do not obey the LORD your God by carefully following all His commandments and statutes I am giving you today, all these curses will come upon you and overtake you:
contents: If, however, you do not obey the LORD your God by carefully following all His commandments and statutes I am giving you today, all these curses will come upon you and overtake you:

contents.verseText: You will be cursed in the city and cursed in the country.
contents: You will be cursed in the city
and cursed in the country.

contents.verseText: Your basket and kneading bowl will be cursed.
contents: Your basket and kneading bowl will be cursed.

contents.verseText: The fruit of your womb will be cursed, as well as the produce of your land, the calves of your herds, and the lambs of your flocks.
contents: The fruit of your womb will be cursed,
as well as the produce of your land,
the calves of your herds,
and the lambs of your flocks.

contents.verseText: You will be cursed when you come in and cursed when you go out.
contents: You will be cursed when you come in
and cursed when you go out.

contents.verseText: The LORD will send curses upon you, confusion and reproof in all to which you put your hand, until you are destroyed and quickly perish because of the wickedness you have committed in forsaking Him.
contents: The LORD will send curses upon you, confusion and reproof in all to which you put your hand, until you are destroyed and quickly perish because of the wickedness you have committed in forsaking Him.

footnote.ft: Hebrew Me

contents.verseText: The LORD will make the plague cling to you until He has exterminated you from the land that you are entering to possess.
contents: The LORD will make the plague cling to you until He has exterminated you from the land that you are entering to possess.

contents.verseText: The LORD will strike you with wasting disease, with fever and inflammation, with scorching heat and drought, and with blight and mildew; these will pursue you until you perish.
contents: The LORD will strike you with wasting disease, with fever and inflammation, with scorching heat and drought,

footnote.ft: Or sword

contents: and with blight and mildew; these will pursue you until you perish.

contents.verseText: The sky over your head will be bronze, and the earth beneath you iron.
contents: The sky over your head will be bronze, and the earth beneath you iron.

contents.verseText: The LORD will turn the rain of your land into dust and powder; it will descend on you from the sky until you are destroyed.
contents: The LORD will turn the rain of your land into dust and powder; it will descend on you from the sky until you are destroyed.

contents.verseText: The LORD will cause you to be defeated before your enemies. You will march out against them in one direction but flee from them in seven. You will be an object of horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.
contents: The LORD will cause you to be defeated before your enemies. You will march out against them in one direction but flee from them in seven. You will be an object of horror to all the kingdoms of the earth.

contents.verseText: Your corpses will be food for all the birds of the air and beasts of the earth, with no one to scare them away.
contents: Your corpses will be food for all the birds of the air and beasts of the earth, with no one to scare them away.

contents.verseText: The LORD will afflict you with the boils of Egypt, with tumors and scabs and itch from which you cannot be cured.
contents: The LORD will afflict you with the boils of Egypt, with tumors and scabs and itch from which you cannot be cured.

contents.verseText: The LORD will afflict you with madness, blindness, and confusion of mind,
contents: The LORD will afflict you with madness, blindness, and confusion of mind,

contents.verseText: and at noon you will grope about like a blind man in the darkness. You will not prosper in your ways. Day after day you will be oppressed and plundered, with no one to save you.
contents: and at noon you will grope about like a blind man in the darkness. You will not prosper in your ways. Day after day you will be oppressed and plundered, with no one to save you.

contents.verseText: You will be pledged in marriage to a woman, but another man will violate her. You will build a house but will not live in it. You will plant a vineyard but will not enjoy its fruit.
contents: You will be pledged in marriage to a woman, but another man will violate her. You will build a house but will not live in it. You will plant a vineyard but will not enjoy its fruit.

contents.verseText: Your ox will be slaughtered before your eyes, but you will not eat any of it. Your donkey will be taken away and not returned to you. Your flock will be given to your enemies, and no one will save you.
contents: Your ox will be slaughtered before your eyes, but you will not eat any of it. Your donkey will be taken away and not returned to you. Your flock will be given to your enemies, and no one will save you.

contents.verseText: Your sons and daughters will be given to another nation, while your eyes grow weary looking for them day after day, with no power in your hand.
contents: Your sons and daughters will be given to another nation, while your eyes grow weary looking for them day after day, with no power in your hand.

contents.verseText: A people you do not know will eat the produce of your land and of all your toil. All your days you will be oppressed and crushed.
contents: A people you do not know will eat the produce of your land and of all your toil. All your days you will be oppressed and crushed.

contents.verseText: You will be driven mad by the sights you see.
contents: You will be driven mad by the sights you see.

contents.verseText: The LORD will afflict you with painful, incurable boils on your knees and thighs, from the soles of your feet to the top of your head.
contents: The LORD will afflict you with painful, incurable boils on your knees and thighs, from the soles of your feet to the top of your head.

contents.verseText: The LORD will bring you and the king you appoint to a nation neither you nor your fathers have known, and there you will worship other gods—gods of wood and stone.
contents: The LORD will bring you and the king you appoint to a nation neither you nor your fathers have known, and there you will worship other gods—gods of wood and stone.

contents.verseText: You will become an object of horror, scorn, and ridicule among all the nations to which the LORD will drive you.
contents: You will become an object of horror, scorn, and ridicule among all the nations to which the LORD will drive you.

contents.verseText: You will sow much seed in the field but harvest little, because the locusts will consume it.
contents: You will sow much seed in the field but harvest little, because the locusts will consume it.

contents.verseText: You will plant and cultivate vineyards, but will neither drink the wine nor gather the grapes, because worms will eat them.
contents: You will plant and cultivate vineyards, but will neither drink the wine nor gather the grapes, because worms will eat them.

contents.verseText: You will have olive trees throughout your territory but will never anoint yourself with oil, because the olives will drop off.
contents: You will have olive trees throughout your territory but will never anoint yourself with oil, because the olives will drop off.

contents.verseText: You will father sons and daughters, but they will not remain yours, because they will go into captivity.
contents: You will father sons and daughters, but they will not remain yours, because they will go into captivity.

contents.verseText: Swarms of locusts will consume all your trees and the produce of your land.
contents: Swarms of locusts will consume all your trees and the produce of your land.

contents.verseText: The foreigner living among you will rise higher and higher above you, while you sink down lower and lower.
contents: The foreigner living among you will rise higher and higher above you, while you sink down lower and lower.

contents.verseText: He will lend to you, but you will not lend to him. He will be the head, and you will be the tail.
contents: He will lend to you, but you will not lend to him. He will be the head, and you will be the tail.

contents.verseText: All these curses will come upon you. They will pursue you and overtake you until you are destroyed, since you did not obey the LORD your God and keep the commandments and statutes He gave you.
contents: All these curses will come upon you. They will pursue you and overtake you until you are destroyed, since you did not obey the LORD your God and keep the commandments and statutes He gave you.

contents.verseText: These curses will be a sign and a wonder upon you and your descendants forever.
contents: These curses will be a sign and a wonder upon you and your descendants forever.

contents.verseText: Because you did not serve the LORD your God with joy and gladness of heart in all your abundance,
contents: Because you did not serve the LORD your God with joy and gladness of heart in all your abundance,

contents.verseText: you will serve your enemies the LORD will send against you in famine, thirst, nakedness, and destitution. He will place an iron yoke on your neck until He has destroyed you.
contents: you will serve your enemies the LORD will send against you in famine, thirst, nakedness, and destitution. He will place an iron yoke on your neck until He has destroyed you.

contents.verseText: The LORD will bring a nation from afar, from the ends of the earth, to swoop down upon you like an eagle—a nation whose language you will not understand,
contents: The LORD will bring a nation from afar, from the ends of the earth, to swoop down upon you like an eagle—a nation whose language you will not understand,

contents.verseText: a ruthless nation with no respect for the old and no pity for the young.
contents: a ruthless nation with no respect for the old and no pity for the young.

contents.verseText: They will eat the offspring of your livestock and the produce of your land until you are destroyed. They will leave you no grain or new wine or oil, no calves of your herds or lambs of your flocks, until they have caused you to perish.
contents: They will eat the offspring of your livestock and the produce of your land until you are destroyed. They will leave you no grain or new wine or oil, no calves of your herds or lambs of your flocks, until they have caused you to perish.

contents.verseText: They will besiege all the cities throughout your land, until the high and fortified walls in which you trust have fallen. They will besiege all your cities throughout the land that the LORD your God has given you.
contents: They will besiege all the cities throughout your land, until the high and fortified walls in which you trust have fallen. They will besiege all your cities throughout the land that the LORD your God has given you.

contents.verseText: Then you will eat the fruit of your womb, the flesh of the sons and daughters whom the LORD your God has given you, in the siege and distress that your enemy will inflict on you.
contents: Then you will eat the fruit of your womb, the flesh of the sons and daughters whom the LORD your God has given you, in the siege and distress that your enemy will inflict on you.

contents.verseText: The most gentle and refined man among you will begrudge his brother, the wife he embraces, and the rest of his children who have survived,
contents: The most gentle and refined man among you will begrudge his brother, the wife he embraces,

footnote.ft: Hebrew the wife of his bosom

contents: and the rest of his children who have survived,

contents.verseText: refusing to share with any of them the flesh of his children he will eat because he has nothing left in the siege and distress that your enemy will inflict on you within all your gates.
contents: refusing to share with any of them the flesh of his children he will eat because he has nothing left in the siege and distress that your enemy will inflict on you within all your gates.

footnote.ft: Or within all your cities; similarly in verse 57

contents.verseText: The most gentle and refined woman among you, so gentle and refined she would not venture to set the sole of her foot on the ground, will begrudge the husband she embraces and her son and daughter
contents: The most gentle and refined woman among you, so gentle and refined she would not venture to set the sole of her foot on the ground, will begrudge the husband she embraces

footnote.ft: Hebrew the husband of her bosom

contents: and her son and daughter

contents.verseText: the afterbirth that comes from between her legs and the children she bears, because she will secretly eat them for lack of anything else in the siege and distress that your enemy will inflict on you within your gates.
contents: the afterbirth that comes from between her legs and the children she bears, because she will secretly eat them for lack of anything else in the siege and distress that your enemy will inflict on you within your gates.

contents.verseText: If you are not careful to observe all the words of this law which are written in this book, that you may fear this glorious and awesome name—the LORD your God—
contents: If you are not careful to observe all the words of this law which are written in this book, that you may fear this glorious and awesome name—the LORD your God—

contents.verseText: He will bring upon you and your descendants extraordinary disasters, severe and lasting plagues, and terrible and chronic sicknesses.
contents: He will bring upon you and your descendants extraordinary disasters, severe and lasting plagues, and terrible and chronic sicknesses.

contents.verseText: He will afflict you again with all the diseases you dreaded in Egypt, and they will cling to you.
contents: He will afflict you again with all the diseases you dreaded in Egypt, and they will cling to you.

contents.verseText: The LORD will also bring upon you every sickness and plague not recorded in this Book of the Law, until you are destroyed.
contents: The LORD will also bring upon you every sickness and plague not recorded in this Book of the Law, until you are destroyed.

contents.verseText: You who were as numerous as the stars in the sky will be left few in number, because you would not obey the voice of the LORD your God.
contents: You who were as numerous as the stars in the sky will be left few in number, because you would not obey the voice of the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: Just as it pleased the LORD to make you prosper and multiply, so also it will please Him to annihilate you and destroy you. And you will be uprooted from the land you are entering to possess.
contents: Just as it pleased the LORD to make you prosper and multiply, so also it will please Him to annihilate you and destroy you. And you will be uprooted from the land you are entering to possess.

contents.verseText: Then the LORD will scatter you among all the nations, from one end of the earth to the other, and there you will worship other gods, gods of wood and stone, which neither you nor your fathers have known.
contents: Then the LORD will scatter you among all the nations, from one end of the earth to the other, and there you will worship other gods, gods of wood and stone, which neither you nor your fathers have known.

contents.verseText: Among those nations you will find no repose, not even a resting place for the sole of your foot. There the LORD will give you a trembling heart, failing eyes, and a despairing soul.
contents: Among those nations you will find no repose, not even a resting place for the sole of your foot. There the LORD will give you a trembling heart, failing eyes, and a despairing soul.

contents.verseText: So your life will hang in doubt before you, and you will be afraid night and day, never certain of survival.
contents: So your life will hang in doubt before you, and you will be afraid night and day, never certain of survival.

contents.verseText: In the morning you will say, ‘If only it were evening!’ and in the evening you will say, ‘If only it were morning!’—because of the dread in your hearts of the terrifying sights you will see.
contents: In the morning you will say, ‘If only it were evening!’ and in the evening you will say, ‘If only it were morning!’—because of the dread in your hearts of the terrifying sights you will see.

contents.verseText: The LORD will return you to Egypt in ships by a route that I said you should never see again. There you will sell yourselves to your enemies as male and female slaves, but no one will buy you.”
contents: The LORD will return you to Egypt in ships by a route that I said you should never see again. There you will sell yourselves to your enemies as male and female slaves, but no one will buy you.”

contents.verseText: These are the words of the covenant that the LORD commanded Moses to make with the Israelites in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant He had made with them at Horeb.
contents: These are the words of the covenant that the LORD commanded Moses to make with the Israelites in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant He had made with them at Horeb.

footnote.ft: That is, Mount Sinai, or possibly a mountain in the range containing Mount Sinai

contents.verseText: Moses summoned all Israel and proclaimed to them, “You have seen with your own eyes everything the LORD did in Egypt to Pharaoh, to all his officials, and to all his land.
contents: Moses summoned all Israel and proclaimed to them, “You have seen with your own eyes everything the LORD did in Egypt to Pharaoh, to all his officials, and to all his land.

contents.verseText: You saw with your own eyes the great trials, and those miraculous signs and wonders.
contents: You saw with your own eyes the great trials, and those miraculous signs and wonders.

contents.verseText: Yet to this day the LORD has not given you a mind to understand, eyes to see, or ears to hear.
contents: Yet to this day the LORD has not given you a mind to understand, eyes to see, or ears to hear.

contents.verseText: For forty years I led you in the wilderness, yet your clothes and sandals did not wear out.
contents: For forty years I led you in the wilderness,
yet your clothes and sandals did not wear out.

contents.verseText: You ate no bread and drank no wine or strong drink, so that you might know that I am the LORD your God.
contents: You ate no bread and drank no wine or strong drink,
so that you might know that I am the LORD your God.

contents.verseText: When you reached this place, Sihon king of Heshbon and Og king of Bashan came out against us in battle, but we defeated them.
contents: When you reached this place, Sihon king of Heshbon and Og king of Bashan came out against us in battle, but we defeated them.

contents.verseText: We took their land and gave it as an inheritance to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
contents: We took their land and gave it as an inheritance to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

contents.verseText: So keep and follow the words of this covenant, that you may prosper in all you do.
contents: So keep and follow the words of this covenant, that you may prosper in all you do.

contents.verseText: All of you are standing today before the LORD your God—you leaders of tribes, elders, officials, and all the men of Israel,
contents: All of you are standing today before the LORD your God—you leaders of tribes,

footnote.ft: LXX and Syriac; Hebrew you leaders, tribes

contents: elders, officials, and all the men of Israel,

contents.verseText: your children and wives, and the foreigners in your camps who cut your wood and draw your water—
contents: your children and wives, and the foreigners in your camps who cut your wood and draw your water—

contents.verseText: so that you may enter into the covenant of the LORD your God, which He is making with you today, and into His oath,
contents: so that you may enter into the covenant of the LORD your God, which He is making with you today, and into His oath,

contents.verseText: and so that He may establish you today as His people, and He may be your God as He promised you and as He swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.
contents: and so that He may establish you today as His people, and He may be your God as He promised you and as He swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

contents.verseText: I am making this covenant and this oath not only with you,
contents: I am making this covenant and this oath not only with you,

contents.verseText: but also with those who are standing here with us today in the presence of the LORD our God, as well as with those who are not here today.
contents: but also with those who are standing here with us today in the presence of the LORD our God, as well as with those who are not here today.

contents.verseText: For you yourselves know how we lived in the land of Egypt and how we passed through the nations on the way here.
contents: For you yourselves know how we lived in the land of Egypt and how we passed through the nations on the way here.

contents.verseText: You saw the abominations and idols among them made of wood and stone, of silver and gold.
contents: You saw the abominations and idols among them made of wood and stone, of silver and gold.

contents.verseText: Make sure there is no man or woman, clan or tribe among you today whose heart turns away from the LORD our God to go and worship the gods of those nations. Make sure there is no root among you that bears such poisonous and bitter fruit,
contents: Make sure there is no man or woman, clan or tribe among you today whose heart turns away from the LORD our God to go and worship the gods of those nations. Make sure there is no root among you that bears such poisonous and bitter fruit,

footnote.ft: See Hebrews 12:15

contents.verseText: because when such a person hears the words of this oath, he invokes a blessing on himself, saying, ‘I will have peace, even though I walk in the stubbornness of my own heart.’ This will bring disaster on the watered land as well as the dry.
contents: because when such a person hears the words of this oath,

footnote.ft: Or curse

contents: he invokes a blessing on himself, saying, ‘I will have peace, even though I walk in the stubbornness of my own heart.’
This will bring disaster on the watered land as well as the dry.

contents.verseText: The LORD will never be willing to forgive him. Instead, His anger and jealousy will burn against that man, and every curse written in this book will fall upon him. The LORD will blot out his name from under heaven
contents: The LORD will never be willing to forgive him. Instead, His anger and jealousy will burn against that man, and every curse written in this book will fall upon him. The LORD will blot out his name from under heaven

contents.verseText: and single him out from all the tribes of Israel for disaster, according to all the curses of the covenant written in this Book of the Law.
contents: and single him out from all the tribes of Israel for disaster, according to all the curses of the covenant written in this Book of the Law.

contents.verseText: Then the generation to come—your sons who follow you and the foreigner who comes from a distant land—will see the plagues of the land and the sicknesses the LORD has inflicted on it.
contents: Then the generation to come—your sons who follow you and the foreigner who comes from a distant land—will see the plagues of the land and the sicknesses the LORD has inflicted on it.

contents.verseText: All its soil will be a burning waste of sulfur and salt, unsown and unproductive, with no plant growing on it, just like the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which the LORD overthrew in His fierce anger.
contents: All its soil will be a burning waste of sulfur and salt, unsown and unproductive, with no plant growing on it, just like the destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which the LORD overthrew in His fierce anger.

contents.verseText: So all the nations will ask, ‘Why has the LORD done such a thing to this land? Why this great outburst of anger?’
contents: So all the nations will ask, ‘Why has the LORD done such a thing to this land? Why this great outburst of anger?’

contents.verseText: And the people will answer, ‘It is because they abandoned the covenant of the LORD, the God of their fathers, which He made with them when He brought them out of the land of Egypt.
contents: And the people will answer, ‘It is because they abandoned the covenant of the LORD, the God of their fathers, which He made with them when He brought them out of the land of Egypt.

contents.verseText: They went and served other gods, and they worshiped gods they had not known—gods that the LORD had not given to them.
contents: They went and served other gods, and they worshiped gods they had not known—gods that the LORD had not given to them.

contents.verseText: Therefore the anger of the LORD burned against this land, and He brought upon it every curse written in this book.
contents: Therefore the anger of the LORD burned against this land, and He brought upon it every curse written in this book.

contents.verseText: The LORD uprooted them from their land in His anger, rage, and great wrath, and He cast them into another land, where they are today.’
contents: The LORD uprooted them from their land in His anger, rage, and great wrath, and He cast them into another land, where they are today.’

contents.verseText: The secret things belong to the LORD our God, but the things revealed belong to us and to our children forever, so that we may follow all the words of this law.
contents: The secret things belong to the LORD our God, but the things revealed belong to us and to our children forever, so that we may follow all the words of this law.

contents.verseText: “When all these things come upon you—the blessings and curses I have set before you—and you call them to mind in all the nations to which the LORD your God has banished you,
contents: “When all these things come upon you—the blessings and curses I have set before you—and you call them to mind in all the nations to which the LORD your God has banished you,

contents.verseText: and when you and your children return to the LORD your God and obey His voice with all your heart and all your soul according to everything I am giving you today,
contents: and when you and your children return to the LORD your God and obey His voice with all your heart and all your soul according to everything I am giving you today,

contents.verseText: then He will restore you from captivity and have compassion on you and gather you from all the nations to which the LORD your God has scattered you.
contents: then He will restore you from captivity

footnote.ft: Or restore your fortunes

contents: and have compassion on you and gather you from all the nations to which the LORD your God has scattered you.

contents.verseText: Even if you have been banished to the farthest horizon, He will gather you and return you from there.
contents: Even if you have been banished to the farthest horizon,

footnote.ft: Or to the extremity of the heavens

contents: He will gather you and return you from there.

footnote.ft: Cited in Nehemiah 1:8–9

contents.verseText: And the LORD your God will bring you into the land your fathers possessed, and you will take possession of it. He will cause you to prosper and multiply more than your fathers.
contents: And the LORD your God will bring you into the land your fathers possessed, and you will take possession of it. He will cause you to prosper and multiply more than your fathers.

contents.verseText: The LORD your God will circumcise your hearts and the hearts of your descendants, and you will love Him with all your heart and with all your soul, so that you may live.
contents: The LORD your God will circumcise your hearts and the hearts of your descendants, and you will love Him with all your heart and with all your soul, so that you may live.

contents.verseText: Then the LORD your God will put all these curses upon your enemies who hate you and persecute you.
contents: Then the LORD your God will put all these curses upon your enemies who hate you and persecute you.

contents.verseText: And you will again obey the voice of the LORD and follow all His commandments I am giving you today.
contents: And you will again obey the voice of the LORD and follow all His commandments I am giving you today.

contents.verseText: So the LORD your God will make you abound in all the work of your hands and in the fruit of your womb, the offspring of your livestock, and the produce of your land. Indeed, the LORD will again delight in your goodness, as He delighted in that of your fathers,
contents: So the LORD your God will make you abound in all the work of your hands and in the fruit of your womb, the offspring of your livestock, and the produce of your land. Indeed, the LORD will again delight in your goodness, as He delighted in that of your fathers,

contents.verseText: if you obey the LORD your God by keeping His commandments and statutes that are written in this Book of the Law, and if you turn to Him with all your heart and with all your soul.
contents: if you obey the LORD your God by keeping His commandments and statutes that are written in this Book of the Law, and if you turn to Him with all your heart and with all your soul.

contents.verseText: For this commandment I give you today is not too difficult for you or beyond your reach.
contents: For this commandment I give you today is not too difficult for you or beyond your reach.

contents.verseText: It is not in heaven, that you should need to ask, ‘Who will ascend into heaven to get it for us and proclaim it, that we may obey it?’
contents: It is not in heaven, that you should need to ask, ‘Who will ascend into heaven

contents: to get it for us and proclaim it, that we may obey it?’

contents.verseText: And it is not beyond the sea, that you should need to ask, ‘Who will cross the sea to get it for us and proclaim it, that we may obey it?’
contents: And it is not beyond the sea, that you should need to ask, ‘Who will cross the sea

footnote.ft: See Romans 10:7.

contents: to get it for us and proclaim it, that we may obey it?’

contents.verseText: But the word is very near you; it is in your mouth and in your heart, so that you may obey it.
contents: But the word is very near you; it is in your mouth and in your heart,

footnote.ft: Cited in Romans 10:8

contents: so that you may obey it.

contents.verseText: See, I have set before you today life and goodness, as well as death and disaster.
contents: See, I have set before you today life and goodness, as well as death and disaster.

contents.verseText: For I am commanding you today to love the LORD your God, to walk in His ways, and to keep His commandments, statutes, and ordinances, so that you may live and increase, and the LORD your God may bless you in the land that you are entering to possess.
contents: For I am commanding you today to love the LORD your God, to walk in His ways, and to keep His commandments, statutes, and ordinances, so that you may live and increase, and the LORD your God may bless you in the land that you are entering to possess.

contents.verseText: But if your heart turns away and you do not listen, but are drawn away to bow down to other gods and worship them,
contents: But if your heart turns away and you do not listen, but are drawn away to bow down to other gods and worship them,

contents.verseText: I declare to you today that you will surely perish; you shall not prolong your days in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.
contents: I declare to you today that you will surely perish; you shall not prolong your days in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.

contents.verseText: I call heaven and earth as witnesses against you today that I have set before you life and death, blessing and cursing. Therefore choose life, so that you and your descendants may live,
contents: I call heaven and earth as witnesses against you today that I have set before you life and death, blessing and cursing. Therefore choose life, so that you and your descendants may live,

contents.verseText: and that you may love the LORD your God, obey Him, and hold fast to Him. For He is your life, and He will prolong your life in the land that the LORD swore to give to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.”
contents: and that you may love the LORD your God, obey Him, and hold fast to Him. For He is your life, and He will prolong your life in the land that the LORD swore to give to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.”

contents.verseText: When Moses had finished speaking these words to all Israel,
contents: When Moses had finished speaking

footnote.ft: DSS and LXX; MT When Moses went out and spoke

contents: these words to all Israel,

contents.verseText: he said to them, “I am now a hundred and twenty years old; I am no longer able to come and go, and the LORD has said to me, ‘You shall not cross the Jordan.’
contents: he said to them, “I am now a hundred and twenty years old; I am no longer able to come and go, and the LORD has said to me, ‘You shall not cross the Jordan.’

contents.verseText: The LORD your God Himself will cross over ahead of you. He will destroy these nations before you, and you will dispossess them. Joshua will cross ahead of you, as the LORD has said.
contents: The LORD your God Himself will cross over ahead of you. He will destroy these nations before you, and you will dispossess them. Joshua will cross ahead of you, as the LORD has said.

contents.verseText: And the LORD will do to them as He did to Sihon and Og, the kings of the Amorites, when He destroyed them along with their land.
contents: And the LORD will do to them as He did to Sihon and Og, the kings of the Amorites, when He destroyed them along with their land.

contents.verseText: The LORD will deliver them over to you, and you must do to them exactly as I have commanded you.
contents: The LORD will deliver them over to you, and you must do to them exactly as I have commanded you.

contents.verseText: Be strong and courageous; do not be afraid or terrified of them, for it is the LORD your God who goes with you; He will never leave you nor forsake you.”
contents: Be strong and courageous; do not be afraid or terrified of them, for it is the LORD your God who goes with you; He will never leave you nor forsake you.”

footnote.ft: Cited in Hebrews 13:5; here and in verse 8

contents.verseText: Then Moses called for Joshua and said to him in the presence of all Israel, “Be strong and courageous, for you will go with this people into the land that the LORD swore to their fathers to give them, and you shall give it to them as an inheritance.
contents: Then Moses called for Joshua and said to him in the presence of all Israel, “Be strong and courageous, for you will go with this people into the land that the LORD swore to their fathers to give them, and you shall give it to them as an inheritance.

contents.verseText: The LORD Himself goes before you; He will be with you. He will never leave you nor forsake you. Do not be afraid or discouraged.”
contents: The LORD Himself goes before you; He will be with you. He will never leave you nor forsake you. Do not be afraid or discouraged.”

contents.verseText: So Moses wrote down this law and gave it to the priests, the sons of Levi, who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and to all the elders of Israel.
contents: So Moses wrote down this law and gave it to the priests, the sons of Levi, who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and to all the elders of Israel.

contents.verseText: Then Moses commanded them, “At the end of every seven years, at the appointed time in the year of remission of debt, during the Feast of Tabernacles,
contents: Then Moses commanded them, “At the end of every seven years, at the appointed time in the year of remission of debt, during the Feast of Tabernacles,

footnote.ft: That is, Sukkot, the autumn feast of pilgrimage to Jerusalem; also translated as the Feast of Booths or the Feast of Shelters and originally called the Feast of Ingathering (see Exodus 23:16 and Exodus 34:22).

contents.verseText: when all Israel comes before the LORD your God at the place He will choose, you are to read this law in the hearing of all Israel.
contents: when all Israel comes before the LORD your God at the place He will choose, you are to read this law in the hearing of all Israel.

contents.verseText: Assemble the people—men, women, children, and the foreigners within your gates—so that they may listen and learn to fear the LORD your God and to follow carefully all the words of this law.
contents: Assemble the people—men, women, children, and the foreigners within your gates—so that they may listen and learn to fear the LORD your God and to follow carefully all the words of this law.

contents.verseText: Then their children who do not know the law will listen and learn to fear the LORD your God, as long as you live in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.”
contents: Then their children who do not know the law will listen and learn to fear the LORD your God, as long as you live in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.”

contents.verseText: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Behold, the time of your death is near. Call Joshua and present yourselves at the Tent of Meeting, so that I may commission him.” So Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves at the Tent of Meeting.
contents: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Behold, the time of your death is near. Call Joshua and present yourselves at the Tent of Meeting, so that I may commission him.”
So Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves at the Tent of Meeting.

contents.verseText: Then the LORD appeared at the tent in a pillar of cloud, and the cloud stood over the entrance to the tent.
contents: Then the LORD appeared at the tent in a pillar of cloud, and the cloud stood over the entrance to the tent.

contents.verseText: And the LORD said to Moses, “You will soon rest with your fathers, and these people will rise up and prostitute themselves with the foreign gods of the land they are entering. They will forsake Me and break the covenant I have made with them.
contents: And the LORD said to Moses, “You will soon rest with your fathers, and these people will rise up and prostitute themselves with the foreign gods of the land they are entering. They will forsake Me and break the covenant I have made with them.

contents.verseText: On that day My anger will burn against them, and I will abandon them and hide My face from them, so that they will be consumed, and many troubles and afflictions will befall them. On that day they will say, ‘Have not these disasters come upon us because our God is no longer with us?’
contents: On that day My anger will burn against them, and I will abandon them and hide My face from them, so that they will be consumed, and many troubles and afflictions will befall them.
On that day they will say, ‘Have not these disasters come upon us because our God is no longer with us?’

contents.verseText: And on that day I will surely hide My face because of all the evil they have done by turning to other gods.
contents: And on that day I will surely hide My face because of all the evil they have done by turning to other gods.

contents.verseText: Now therefore, write down for yourselves this song and teach it to the Israelites; have them recite it, so that it may be a witness for Me against them.
contents: Now therefore, write down for yourselves this song and teach it to the Israelites; have them recite it, so that it may be a witness for Me against them.

contents.verseText: When I have brought them into the land that I swore to give their fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey, they will eat their fill and prosper. Then they will turn to other gods and worship them, and they will reject Me and break My covenant.
contents: When I have brought them into the land that I swore to give their fathers, a land flowing with milk and honey, they will eat their fill and prosper. Then they will turn to other gods and worship them, and they will reject Me and break My covenant.

contents.verseText: And when many troubles and afflictions have come upon them, this song will testify against them, because it will not be forgotten from the lips of their descendants. For I know their inclination, even before I bring them into the land that I swore to give them.”
contents: And when many troubles and afflictions have come upon them, this song will testify against them, because it will not be forgotten from the lips of their descendants. For I know their inclination, even before I bring them into the land that I swore to give them.”

contents.verseText: So that very day Moses wrote down this song and taught it to the Israelites.
contents: So that very day Moses wrote down this song and taught it to the Israelites.

contents.verseText: Then the LORD commissioned Joshua son of Nun and said, “Be strong and courageous, for you will bring the Israelites into the land that I swore to give them, and I will be with you.”
contents: Then the LORD commissioned Joshua son of Nun and said, “Be strong and courageous, for you will bring the Israelites into the land that I swore to give them, and I will be with you.”

s1: The Law Placed in the Ark

contents.verseText: When Moses had finished writing in a book the words of this law from beginning to end,
contents: When Moses had finished writing in a book the words of this law from beginning to end,

contents.verseText: he gave this command to the Levites who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD:
contents: he gave this command to the Levites who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD:

contents.verseText: “Take this Book of the Law and place it beside the ark of the covenant of the LORD your God, so that it may remain there as a witness against you.
contents: “Take this Book of the Law and place it beside the ark of the covenant of the LORD your God, so that it may remain there as a witness against you.

contents.verseText: For I know how rebellious and stiff-necked you are. If you are already rebelling against the LORD while I am still alive, how much more will you rebel after my death!
contents: For I know how rebellious and stiff-necked you are. If you are already rebelling against the LORD while I am still alive, how much more will you rebel after my death!

contents.verseText: Assemble before me all the elders of your tribes and all your officers so that I may speak these words in their hearing and call heaven and earth to witness against them.
contents: Assemble before me all the elders of your tribes and all your officers so that I may speak these words in their hearing and call heaven and earth to witness against them.

contents.verseText: For I know that after my death you will become utterly corrupt and turn from the path I have commanded you. And in the days to come, disaster will befall you because you will do evil in the sight of the LORD to provoke Him to anger by the work of your hands.”
contents: For I know that after my death you will become utterly corrupt and turn from the path I have commanded you. And in the days to come, disaster will befall you because you will do evil in the sight of the LORD to provoke Him to anger by the work of your hands.”

contents.verseText: Then Moses recited aloud to the whole assembly of Israel the words of this song from beginning to end:
contents: Then Moses recited aloud to the whole assembly of Israel the words of this song from beginning to end:

contents.verseText: Give ear, O heavens, and I will speak; hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
contents: Give ear, O heavens, and I will speak;
hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.

contents.verseText: Let my teaching fall like rain and my speech settle like dew, like gentle rain on new grass, like showers on tender plants.
contents: Let my teaching fall like rain
and my speech settle like dew,
like gentle rain on new grass,
like showers on tender plants.

contents.verseText: For I will proclaim the name of the LORD. Ascribe greatness to our God!
contents: For I will proclaim the name of the LORD.
Ascribe greatness to our God!

contents.verseText: He is the Rock, His work is perfect; all His ways are just. A God of faithfulness without injustice, righteous and upright is He.
contents: He is the Rock, His work is perfect;
all His ways are just.
A God of faithfulness without injustice,
righteous and upright is He.

contents.verseText: His people have acted corruptly toward Him; the spot on them is not that of His children, but of a perverse and crooked generation.
contents: His people have acted corruptly toward Him;
the spot on them is not that of His children,
but of a perverse and crooked generation.

footnote.ft: Cited in Philippians 2:15

contents.verseText: Is this how you repay the LORD, O foolish and senseless people? Is He not your Father and Creator? Has He not made you and established you?
contents: Is this how you repay the LORD,
O foolish and senseless people?
Is He not your Father and Creator?
Has He not made you and established you?

contents.verseText: Remember the days of old; consider the years long past. Ask your father, and he will tell you, your elders, and they will inform you.
contents: Remember the days of old;
consider the years long past.
Ask your father, and he will tell you,
your elders, and they will inform you.

contents.verseText: When the Most High gave the nations their inheritance, when He divided the sons of man, He set the boundaries of the peoples according to the number of the sons of God.
contents: When the Most High gave the nations their inheritance,
when He divided the sons of man,
He set the boundaries of the peoples
according to the number of the sons of God.

footnote.ft: DSS; LXX according to the number of the angels of God; MT according to the number of the sons of Israel

contents.verseText: But the LORD’s portion is His people, Jacob His allotted inheritance.
contents: But the LORD’s portion is His people,
Jacob His allotted inheritance.

contents.verseText: He found him in a desert land, in a barren, howling wilderness; He surrounded him, He instructed him, He guarded him as the apple of His eye.
contents: He found him in a desert land,
in a barren, howling wilderness;
He surrounded him, He instructed him,
He guarded him as the apple

footnote.ft: Literally the pupil

contents: of His eye.

contents.verseText: As an eagle stirs up its nest and hovers over its young, He spread His wings to catch them and carried them on His pinions.
contents: As an eagle stirs up its nest
and hovers over its young,
He spread His wings to catch them
and carried them on His pinions.

footnote.ft: Pinions are the outer parts of a bird’s wings, including the flight feathers.

contents.verseText: The LORD alone led him, and no foreign god was with him.
contents: The LORD alone led him,
and no foreign god was with him.

contents.verseText: He made him ride on the heights of the land and fed him the produce of the field. He nourished him with honey from the rock and oil from the flinty crag,
contents: He made him ride on the heights of the land
and fed him the produce of the field.
He nourished him with honey from the rock
and oil from the flinty crag,

contents.verseText: with curds from the herd and milk from the flock, with the fat of lambs, with rams from Bashan, and goats, with the choicest grains of wheat. From the juice of the finest grapes you drank the wine.
contents: with curds from the herd and milk from the flock,
with the fat of lambs,
with rams from Bashan, and goats,
with the choicest grains of wheat.
From the juice of the finest grapes
you drank the wine.

contents.verseText: But Jeshurun grew fat and kicked—becoming fat, bloated, and gorged. He abandoned the God who made him and scorned the Rock of his salvation.
contents: But Jeshurun

footnote.ft: Jeshurun means the upright one, a term of endearment for Israel.

contents: grew fat and kicked—
becoming fat, bloated, and gorged.
He abandoned the God who made him
and scorned the Rock of his salvation.

contents.verseText: They provoked His jealousy with foreign gods; they enraged Him with abominations.
contents: They provoked His jealousy with foreign gods;
they enraged Him with abominations.

contents.verseText: They sacrificed to demons, not to God, to gods they had not known, to newly arrived gods, which your fathers did not fear.
contents: They sacrificed to demons, not to God,
to gods they had not known,
to newly arrived gods,
which your fathers did not fear.

contents.verseText: You ignored the Rock who brought you forth; you forgot the God who gave you birth.
contents: You ignored the Rock who brought you forth;
you forgot the God who gave you birth.

contents.verseText: When the LORD saw this, He rejected them, provoked to anger by His sons and daughters.
contents: When the LORD saw this, He rejected them,
provoked to anger by His sons and daughters.

contents.verseText: He said: “I will hide My face from them; I will see what will be their end. For they are a perverse generation—children of unfaithfulness.
contents: He said: “I will hide My face from them;
I will see what will be their end.
For they are a perverse generation—
children of unfaithfulness.

contents.verseText: They have provoked My jealousy by that which is not God; they have enraged Me with their worthless idols. So I will make them jealous by those who are not a people; I will make them angry by a nation without understanding.
contents: They have provoked My jealousy by that which is not God;
they have enraged Me with their worthless idols.
So I will make them jealous by those who are not a people;

footnote.ft: Or not a nation; see also LXX.

contents: I will make them angry by a nation without understanding.

footnote.ft: Cited in Romans 10:19

contents.verseText: For a fire has been kindled by My anger, and it burns to the depths of Sheol; it consumes the earth and its produce, and scorches the foundations of the mountains.
contents: For a fire has been kindled by My anger,
and it burns to the depths of Sheol;
it consumes the earth and its produce,
and scorches the foundations of the mountains.

contents.verseText: I will heap disasters upon them; I will spend My arrows against them.
contents: I will heap disasters upon them;
I will spend My arrows against them.

contents.verseText: They will be wasted from hunger and ravaged by pestilence and bitter plague; I will send the fangs of wild beasts against them, with the venom of vipers that slither in the dust.
contents: They will be wasted from hunger
and ravaged by pestilence and bitter plague;
I will send the fangs of wild beasts against them,
with the venom of vipers that slither in the dust.

contents.verseText: Outside, the sword will take their children, and inside, terror will strike the young man and the young woman, the infant and the gray-haired man.
contents: Outside, the sword will take their children,
and inside, terror will strike
the young man and the young woman,
the infant and the gray-haired man.

contents.verseText: I would have said that I would cut them to pieces and blot out their memory from mankind,
contents: I would have said that I would cut them to pieces
and blot out their memory from mankind,

contents.verseText: if I had not dreaded the taunt of the enemy, lest their adversaries misunderstand and say: ‘Our own hand has prevailed; it was not the LORD who did all this.’”
contents: if I had not dreaded the taunt of the enemy,
lest their adversaries misunderstand and say:
‘Our own hand has prevailed;
it was not the LORD who did all this.’”

contents.verseText: Israel is a nation devoid of counsel, with no understanding among them.
contents: Israel is a nation devoid of counsel,
with no understanding among them.

contents.verseText: If only they were wise, they would understand it; they would comprehend their fate.
contents: If only they were wise, they would understand it;
they would comprehend their fate.

contents.verseText: How could one man pursue a thousand, or two put ten thousand to flight, unless their Rock had sold them, unless the LORD had given them up?
contents: How could one man pursue a thousand,
or two put ten thousand to flight,
unless their Rock had sold them,
unless the LORD had given them up?

contents.verseText: For their rock is not like our Rock, even our enemies concede.
contents: For their rock is not like our Rock,
even our enemies concede.

footnote.ft: Hebrew; LXX but our enemies are void of understanding

contents.verseText: But their vine is from the vine of Sodom and from the fields of Gomorrah. Their grapes are poisonous; their clusters are bitter.
contents: But their vine is from the vine of Sodom
and from the fields of Gomorrah.
Their grapes are poisonous;
their clusters are bitter.

contents.verseText: Their wine is the venom of serpents, the deadly poison of cobras.
contents: Their wine is the venom of serpents,
the deadly poison of cobras.

contents.verseText: “Have I not stored up these things, sealed up within My vaults?
contents: “Have I not stored up these things,
sealed up within My vaults?

contents.verseText: Vengeance is Mine; I will repay. In due time their foot will slip; for their day of disaster is near, and their doom is coming quickly.”
contents: Vengeance is Mine; I will repay.

footnote.ft: LXX; Hebrew Vengeance is Mine, and recompense; cited in Romans 12:19 and Hebrews 10:30

contents: In due time their foot will slip;
for their day of disaster is near,
and their doom is coming quickly.”

contents.verseText: For the LORD will vindicate His people and have compassion on His servants when He sees that their strength is gone and no one remains, slave or free.
contents: For the LORD will vindicate His people

footnote.ft: Or will judge His people; see also LXX; cited in Hebrews 10:30

contents: and have compassion on His servants
when He sees that their strength is gone
and no one remains, slave or free.

contents.verseText: He will say: “Where are their gods, the rock in which they took refuge,
contents: He will say: “Where are their gods,
the rock in which they took refuge,

contents.verseText: which ate the fat of their sacrifices and drank the wine of their drink offerings? Let them rise up and help you; let them give you shelter!
contents: which ate the fat of their sacrifices
and drank the wine of their drink offerings?
Let them rise up and help you;
let them give you shelter!

contents.verseText: See now that I am He; there is no God besides Me. I bring death and I give life; I wound and I heal, and there is no one who can deliver from My hand.
contents: See now that I am He;
there is no God besides Me.
I bring death and I give life;
I wound and I heal,
and there is no one
who can deliver from My hand.

contents.verseText: For I lift up My hand to heaven and declare: As surely as I live forever,
contents: For I lift up My hand to heaven and declare:
As surely as I live forever,

contents.verseText: when I sharpen My flashing sword, and My hand grasps it in judgment, I will take vengeance on My adversaries and repay those who hate Me.
contents: when I sharpen My flashing sword,
and My hand grasps it in judgment,
I will take vengeance on My adversaries
and repay those who hate Me.

contents.verseText: I will make My arrows drunk with blood, while My sword devours flesh—the blood of the slain and captives, the heads of the enemy leaders.”
contents: I will make My arrows drunk with blood,
while My sword devours flesh—
the blood of the slain and captives,
the heads of the enemy leaders.”

contents.verseText: Rejoice, O heavens, with Him, and let all God’s angels worship Him. Rejoice, O nations, with His people; for He will avenge the blood of His children. He will take vengeance on His adversaries and repay those who hate Him; He will cleanse His land and His people.
contents: Rejoice, O heavens, with Him,
and let all God’s angels worship Him.

footnote.ft: See DSS and LXX; MT lacks Rejoice, O heavens, with Him, and let all God’s angels worship Him. Cited in Hebrews 1:6

contents: Rejoice, O nations, with His people;

footnote.ft: Cited in Romans 15:10

contents: for He will avenge the blood of His children.

footnote.ft: DSS and LXX; MT servants

contents: He will take vengeance on His adversaries
and repay those who hate Him;

footnote.ft: LXX and Vulgate; MT lacks and repay those who hate Him

contents: He will cleanse His land
and His people.

contents.verseText: Then Moses came with Joshua son of Nun and recited all the words of this song in the hearing of the people.
contents: Then Moses came with Joshua

footnote.ft: LXX, Syriac, and Vulgate; Hebrew Hoshea, a variant of Joshua

contents: son of Nun and recited all the words of this song in the hearing of the people.

contents.verseText: When Moses had finished reciting all these words to all Israel,
contents: When Moses had finished reciting all these words to all Israel,

contents.verseText: he said to them, “Take to heart all these words I testify among you today, so that you may command your children to carefully follow all the words of this law.
contents: he said to them, “Take to heart all these words I testify among you today, so that you may command your children to carefully follow all the words of this law.

contents.verseText: For they are not idle words to you, because they are your life, and by them you will live long in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.”
contents: For they are not idle words to you, because they are your life, and by them you will live long in the land that you are crossing the Jordan to possess.”

contents.verseText: On that same day the LORD said to Moses,
contents: On that same day the LORD said to Moses,

contents.verseText: “Go up into the Abarim Range to Mount Nebo, in the land of Moab across from Jericho, and view the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelites as their own possession.
contents: “Go up into the Abarim Range to Mount Nebo, in the land of Moab across from Jericho, and view the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelites as their own possession.

contents.verseText: And there on the mountain that you climb, you will die and be gathered to your people, just as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his people.
contents: And there on the mountain that you climb, you will die and be gathered to your people, just as your brother Aaron died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his people.

contents.verseText: For at the waters of Meribah-kadesh in the Wilderness of Zin, both of you broke faith with Me among the Israelites by failing to treat Me as holy in their presence.
contents: For at the waters of Meribah-kadesh in the Wilderness of Zin, both of you broke faith with Me among the Israelites by failing to treat Me as holy in their presence.

contents.verseText: Although you shall see from a distance the land that I am giving the Israelites, you shall not enter it.”
contents: Although you shall see from a distance the land that I am giving the Israelites, you shall not enter it.”

contents.verseText: This is the blessing that Moses the man of God pronounced upon the Israelites before his death.
contents: This is the blessing that Moses the man of God pronounced upon the Israelites before his death.

contents.verseText: He said: “The LORD came from Sinai and dawned upon us from Seir; He shone forth from Mount Paran and came with myriads of holy ones, with flaming fire at His right hand.
contents: He said:
“The LORD came from Sinai
and dawned upon us

footnote.ft: LXX, Syriac, and Vulgate; Hebrew upon them

contents: from Seir;
He shone forth from Mount Paran
and came with myriads of holy ones,
with flaming fire at His right hand.

footnote.ft: Or with myriads of holy ones from the south, from His mountain slopes

contents.verseText: Surely You love the people; all the holy ones are in Your hand, and they sit down at Your feet; each receives Your words—
contents: Surely You love the people;
all the holy ones are in Your hand,
and they sit down at Your feet;

footnote.ft: Or they follow in Your steps

contents: each receives Your words—

contents.verseText: the law that Moses gave us, the possession of the assembly of Jacob.
contents: the law that Moses gave us,
the possession of the assembly of Jacob.

contents.verseText: So the LORD became King in Jeshurun when the leaders of the people gathered, when the tribes of Israel came together.
contents: So the LORD became King in Jeshurun

footnote.ft: Jeshurun means the upright one, a term of endearment for Israel; also in verse 26.

contents: when the leaders of the people gathered,
when the tribes of Israel came together.

contents.verseText: Let Reuben live and not die, nor his men be few.”
contents: Let Reuben live and not die,
nor

footnote.ft: Or but let

contents: his men be few.”

contents.verseText: And concerning Judah he said: “O LORD, hear the cry of Judah and bring him to his people. With his own hands he defends his cause, but may You be a help against his foes.”
contents: And concerning Judah he said:
“O LORD, hear the cry of Judah
and bring him to his people.
With his own hands he defends his cause,
but may You be a help against his foes.”

contents.verseText: Concerning Levi he said: “Give Your Thummim to Levi and Your Urim to Your godly one, whom You tested at Massah and contested at the waters of Meribah.
contents: Concerning Levi he said:
“Give Your Thummim to Levi
and Your Urim to Your godly one,

footnote.ft: DSS and LXX; MT does not include to Levi; literally Let Your Perfections and Your Lights be to Your godly one.

contents: whom You tested at Massah

footnote.ft: Massah means testing; see Exodus 17:7.

contents: and contested at the waters of Meribah.

footnote.ft: Meribah means quarreling; see Exodus 17:7.

contents.verseText: He said of his father and mother, ‘I do not consider them.’ He disregarded his brothers and did not know his own sons, for he kept Your word and maintained Your covenant.
contents: He said of his father and mother,
‘I do not consider them.’
He disregarded his brothers
and did not know his own sons,
for he kept

footnote.ft: Hebrew they kept, most likely referring to Levi in the plural; similarly twice in verse 10

contents: Your word
and maintained Your covenant.

contents.verseText: He will teach Your ordinances to Jacob and Your law to Israel; he will set incense before You and whole burnt offerings on Your altar.
contents: He will teach Your ordinances to Jacob
and Your law to Israel;
he will set incense before You
and whole burnt offerings on Your altar.

contents.verseText: Bless his substance, O LORD, and accept the work of his hands. Smash the loins of those who rise against him, and of his foes so they can rise no more.”
contents: Bless his substance, O LORD,
and accept the work of his hands.
Smash the loins of those who rise against him,
and of his foes so they can rise no more.”

contents.verseText: Concerning Benjamin he said: “May the beloved of the LORD rest secure in Him; God shields him all day long, and upon His shoulders he rests.”
contents: Concerning Benjamin he said:
“May the beloved of the LORD
rest secure in Him;
God shields

footnote.ft: LXX; Hebrew He shields

contents: him all day long,
and upon His shoulders he rests.”

contents.verseText: Concerning Joseph he said: “May his land be blessed by the LORD with the precious dew from heaven above and the deep waters that lie beneath,
contents: Concerning Joseph he said:
“May his land be blessed by the LORD
with the precious dew from heaven above
and the deep waters that lie beneath,

contents.verseText: with the bountiful harvest from the sun and the abundant yield of the seasons,
contents: with the bountiful harvest from the sun
and the abundant yield of the seasons,

contents.verseText: with the best of the ancient mountains and the bounty of the everlasting hills,
contents: with the best of the ancient mountains
and the bounty of the everlasting hills,

contents.verseText: with the choice gifts of the land and everything in it, and with the favor of Him who dwelt in the burning bush. May these rest on the head of Joseph and crown the brow of the prince of his brothers.
contents: with the choice gifts of the land and everything in it,
and with the favor of Him who dwelt in the burning bush.
May these rest on the head of Joseph
and crown the brow of the prince of his brothers.

contents.verseText: His majesty is like a firstborn bull, and his horns are like those of a wild ox. With them he will gore the nations, even to the ends of the earth. Such are the myriads of Ephraim, and such are the thousands of Manasseh.”
contents: His majesty is like a firstborn bull,
and his horns are like those of a wild ox.
With them he will gore the nations,
even to the ends of the earth.
Such are the myriads of Ephraim,
and such are the thousands of Manasseh.”

contents.verseText: Concerning Zebulun he said: “Rejoice, Zebulun, in your journeys, and Issachar, in your tents.
contents: Concerning Zebulun he said:
“Rejoice, Zebulun, in your journeys,
and Issachar, in your tents.

contents.verseText: They will call the peoples to a mountain; there they will offer sacrifices of righteousness. For they will feast on the abundance of the seas and the hidden treasures of the sand.”
contents: They will call the peoples to a mountain;
there they will offer sacrifices of righteousness.
For they will feast on the abundance of the seas
and the hidden treasures of the sand.”

contents.verseText: Concerning Gad he said: “Blessed is he who enlarges the domain of Gad! He lies down like a lion and tears off an arm or a head.
contents: Concerning Gad he said:
“Blessed is he who enlarges
the domain of Gad!
He lies down like a lion
and tears off an arm or a head.

contents.verseText: He chose the best land for himself, because a ruler’s portion was reserved for him there. He came with the leaders of the people; he administered the LORD’s justice and His ordinances for Israel.”
contents: He chose the best land for himself,
because a ruler’s portion was reserved for him there.
He came with the leaders of the people;
he administered the LORD’s justice
and His ordinances for Israel.”

contents.verseText: Concerning Dan he said: “Dan is a lion’s cub, leaping out of Bashan.”
contents: Concerning Dan he said:
“Dan is a lion’s cub,
leaping out of Bashan.”

contents.verseText: Concerning Naphtali he said: “Naphtali is abounding with favor, full of the blessing of the LORD; he shall take possession of the sea and the south.”
contents: Concerning Naphtali he said:
“Naphtali is abounding with favor,
full of the blessing of the LORD;
he shall take possession
of the sea

footnote.ft: Or the west

contents: and the south.”

contents.verseText: And concerning Asher he said: “May Asher be the most blessed of sons; may he be the most favored among his brothers and dip his foot in oil.
contents: And concerning Asher he said:
“May Asher be the most blessed of sons;
may he be the most favored among his brothers
and dip his foot in oil.

contents.verseText: May the bolts of your gate be iron and bronze, and may your strength match your days.”
contents: May the bolts of your gate be iron and bronze,
and may your strength match your days.”

contents.verseText: “There is none like the God of Jeshurun, who rides the heavens to your aid, and the clouds in His majesty.
contents: “There is none like the God of Jeshurun,
who rides the heavens to your aid,
and the clouds in His majesty.

contents.verseText: The eternal God is your dwelling place, and underneath are the everlasting arms. He drives out the enemy before you, giving the command, ‘Destroy him!’
contents: The eternal God is your dwelling place,
and underneath are the everlasting arms.
He drives out the enemy before you,
giving the command, ‘Destroy him!’

contents.verseText: So Israel dwells securely; the fountain of Jacob lives untroubled in a land of grain and new wine, where even the heavens drip with dew.
contents: So Israel dwells securely;
the fountain of Jacob lives untroubled
in a land of grain and new wine,
where even the heavens drip with dew.

contents.verseText: Blessed are you, O Israel! Who is like you, a people saved by the LORD? He is the shield that protects you, the sword in which you boast. Your enemies will cower before you, and you shall trample their high places.”
contents: Blessed are you, O Israel!
Who is like you, a people saved by the LORD?
He is the shield that protects you,
the sword in which you boast.
Your enemies will cower before you,
and you shall trample their high places.”

contents.verseText: Then Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, which faces Jericho. And the LORD showed him the whole land—from Gilead as far as Dan,
contents: Then Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, which faces Jericho. And the LORD showed him the whole land—from Gilead as far as Dan,

contents.verseText: all of Naphtali, the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the land of Judah as far as the Western Sea,
contents: all of Naphtali, the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the land of Judah as far as the Western Sea,

footnote.ft: That is, the Mediterranean Sea, also called the Great Sea

contents.verseText: the Negev, and the region from the Valley of Jericho (the City of Palms) all the way to Zoar.
contents: the Negev, and the region from the Valley of Jericho (the City of Palms) all the way to Zoar.

contents.verseText: And the LORD said to him, “This is the land that I swore to give Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob when I said, ‘I will give it to your descendants.’ I have let you see it with your own eyes, but you will not cross into it.”
contents: And the LORD said to him, “This is the land that I swore to give Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob when I said, ‘I will give it to your descendants.’ I have let you see it with your own eyes, but you will not cross into it.”

contents.verseText: So Moses the servant of the LORD died there in the land of Moab, as the LORD had said.
contents: So Moses the servant of the LORD died there in the land of Moab, as the LORD had said.

contents.verseText: And He buried him in a valley in the land of Moab facing Beth-peor, and no one to this day knows the location of his grave.
contents: And He buried him

footnote.ft: SP and some LXX manuscripts they buried him

contents: in a valley in the land of Moab facing Beth-peor, and no one to this day knows the location of his grave.

contents.verseText: Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died, yet his eyes were not weak, and his vitality had not diminished.
contents: Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died, yet his eyes were not weak, and his vitality had not diminished.

contents.verseText: The Israelites grieved for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days, until the time of weeping and mourning for Moses came to an end.
contents: The Israelites grieved for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days, until the time of weeping and mourning for Moses came to an end.

contents.verseText: Now Joshua son of Nun was filled with the spirit of wisdom because Moses had laid his hands on him. So the Israelites obeyed him and did as the LORD had commanded Moses.
contents: Now Joshua son of Nun was filled with the spirit of wisdom because Moses had laid his hands on him. So the Israelites obeyed him and did as the LORD had commanded Moses.

contents.verseText: Since that time, no prophet has risen in Israel like Moses, whom the LORD knew face to face—
contents: Since that time, no prophet has risen in Israel like Moses, whom the LORD knew face to face—

contents.verseText: no prophet who did all the signs and wonders that the LORD sent Moses to do in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh and to all his officials and all his land,
contents: no prophet who did all the signs and wonders that the LORD sent Moses to do in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh and to all his officials and all his land,

contents.verseText: and no prophet who performed all the mighty acts of power and awesome deeds that Moses did in the sight of all Israel.
contents: and no prophet who performed all the mighty acts of power and awesome deeds

footnote.ft: Or terrifying deeds

contents: that Moses did in the sight of all Israel.
